The village bank loan group consists of seventeen people and they all live in Peak Bang’aong village in Takeo province. Mrs.Yum U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Siem Ny, is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple works hard, they still earn only a small income to support the household. Thus, Mrs. Yum U. decided to ask for a loan to buy some chickens for breeding to earn more household income. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy some chickens for breeding to earn more household income.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia F., 59 years old.  Her husband, Benjamin, is a florist.  They have three children.  Twenty years ago, her family used to live among the squatters in Parañaque City.  They were included among the first families to relocate to a government relocation site in Caloocan City and have lived in Tala, Caloocan City ever since.  

Letecia established her general store four years after relocating to Tala.  Her store has been serving her neighbors for sixteen years now.  She now earns P5,000.00 a month.  She came to know the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005.  She has applied for a new loan of P10,000.00 as additional capital for her general store.  This would be her 15th loan cycle with CCT.

She dreams of having a larger grocery store someday.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en: Soledad B. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Soledad is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Soledad owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of viands in the local community. Soledad has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Soledad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soledad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Soledad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: P-3, Tag-ibo, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mrs. Sarom Vorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
NineteE. people who are all living in Peak BA.’aong village in TaK. province make up this village bank loan request. Mrs. Sarom V. is a village bank group president who has beE. selected by the members.They will all use the loan in different purposes.  Sarom is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and adversely affects her crop output. In order T. solve this problem, she decided T. ask for a loan T. buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money T. buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Noeurn Chantha, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Sarom V. is 38 years old and the mother of four childrE. who are enrolled in the local school. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required T. pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial T. Cambodia’s poor. It allows them T. repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able T.. Most clients start T. make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Emomkul

texts.ru: Эмомкул Куканов проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Жена работает в школе учителем. Сам Эмомкул более 13 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Emomkul K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 46 years old. He is married and has seven children. His wife works as a school teacher. Emomkul has been doing animal husbandry for more than thirteen years. He feeds and sells cattle. His oldest son is working in Russia. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Mr. Khen S. lives in An Doung Samreth village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Sen Mom, is a duck breeder. 

Now Mr. Khen S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and he would use the rest of money to buy ducklings for breeding. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family living. He is 30 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and use the rest of money to buy ducklings for breeding.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.en: A. Abubakr is a hardworking man who has dedicated himself to making his business prosper through great effort. Approximately 11 years ago he began his grocery business, which is located in an open market, and over the years he has improved the structure of his business. Abubakr’s sponsor IMON International, in addition to giving him financial support, has also provided a solution to his economic struggles and Abubakr feels happy and satisfied to work together with them. Thanks to this financial assistance, he has been able to expand his business and clientele. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie B. is from the village of Barinaut, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Rosalie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns a business operating a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosalie is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Saidakbar

texts.en:
Saidakbar is 40 years old, married and has three children. He owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the store. He is requesting a loan of 3000 TJS to increase his stock. Saidakbar is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing everything he can. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase his stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Hudoiberdi

texts.ru: Худойберди Сафаров проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст  51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Худойберди более 2 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. У него есть также постоянные клиенты, мясники. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Hudoiberdi S. lives in the Yavan region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has four children. Hudoiberdi has been doing animal husbandry for more than two years. He feeds and sells large cattle. He has regular customers butchers. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Djavharoy

texts.en:
K. Djavharoy is an enterprising, capable, and very hardworking woman. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan, and sells women’s clothes. She began her own business because her husband was unemployed for some time. Her work allows her to send her three children to school. It is very important to Djavharoy that her children finish school and become honest, hardworking individuals. She is requesting 3000 TJS to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. She wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. You can help Djavharoy provide for the education of her children – please support her!

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
M. Salima is a small entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is married with 4 children, who are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. Being the only bread winner in the family she sells women national dresses and trousers in the famous local market called “Korvon”. Salima is a very hard-working woman. She always achieves all her goals and overcomes different challenges with natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of $825 USD to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale. The only dream of Salima is to ensure her children with a good education and to make them happy. We believe Salima’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years can guarantee further stable expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment. The well being of this family is on your hands. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing women national dresses and trousers to increase the range of selling goods

loans.name: Balhumor

texts.ru: Балхумор Тошова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 41 год. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж работает в "горсети". Сама Балхумор занимается земледелием. Они имеют 5 гектаров земли на котором, хотят в основном выращивать пшеницу. Кредит просит для покупки семян и удобрений для посева. Погашение кредита будет осуществленно после сбора урожая и  дальнейшей продажи.

loans.use: Покупка удобрений и семян

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janneth Susana

texts.es: La señora Janneth Susana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años y es madre de 01 hijo, todos ellos ya independientes.Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta de Medicinas. Se inicio con un capital de S/. 800.00 y poco a poco, fue implementando su Botica, que hoy en día le esta dando muy buenos resultados. Ella y su esposo, están muy contentos, por el logro que obtuvieron, gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.Ya es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias son muy buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada al costado de su casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más medicinas, como: Aspirinas, tetraciclina, panadol antigripal, reoxican, apronax, febrax, de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes. Janeth Susana, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. Manifiesta su mas gentil agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Janneth Susana is a member of the Community Bank "Los Rosales", in the San Jose de Sisa district in Dorado, San Martin. She is married, she is 27 years old and she is the mother of one. She has been selling medicines for the past 5 years. She started out with a capital fund of S/.800 and slowly she set up her store, the same store that today is flourishing. She and her husband are very happy with the results of their efforts, and it is all thanks to the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement. She is now well known by her clients in the district where they live and her daily sales are very good. Currently she is still running the same business located alongside her home, a store that is well equipped to attend the clientele.

With this loan of S/.1000 she will purchase more medicines, such as: aspirines, tetracycline, flu medication, reoxican, apronax, and febrax to better supply her clients. Janneth Susana is a woman with a strong desire to succeed, for the good of her family and for herself. She conveys her most sincere thanks to the Manuela Ramos movement for allowing her to develop as a small-business woman and to support other women that also want to find success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 02 que aun depende de ella.Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de juanes y anticuchos, ubicada en su misma casa.En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario la consumen y Flor los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en litros, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus alimentos.

loans.name: Mulloboi

texts.ru: Холов Муллобой проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Муллобой имеет средне-специальное образование. Он более 3 лет работал "шофером". В данный момент он имеет собственный магазин, в котором занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.

loans.use: Увеличение товараоборота

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Patience and hard work are Analyn C.'s guiding principles. She is thankful to be married to Ernito, who is busy cultivating their rice fields. The couple have three loving children: Evelyn, a 16-year-old high school graduate who has had to stop her studies due to financial problems; Mary Jane, a 14-year-old 3rd year high school student; and Mary Joyce, a 12-year-old 1st year high school student. Analyn owns a store in the village where she lives. She would like to improve her business and her family's lifestyle but the income she generates from her store (500 PHP per week) is only enough to meet their daily needs.

Analyn is the center chief in her center. She hopes that all of the people in her center attain success in life. Analyn wants to expand and improve her store but her capital is insufficient to purchase additional merchandise. For this reason she is requesting additional capital of 5,000 PHP. This will be a big help to Analyn, especially in terms of her business and her children's needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ysolina

texts.es: La señora Ysolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años, es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.Ysolina, lleva 15 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su propio taller de confección de vestidos y como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado.Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grandes y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Ysolina, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ysolina belongs to the Los Rosales Communal Bank in the San José de Sisa district, El Dorado province, San Martín department. She is 32, in a common law marriage, and has three children who are still dependent upon her. Ysolina has been making clothes for 15 years. Little by little she started generated her own income and saving money. She wanted to set up her own shop making clothes. As she has the ability to make clothes, she did not doubt that she could do it. With support from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos she decided to set up her own business, which is located in her own house. It is in a very well-equipped space. She tells us that her sewing is going very well for her. She works on orders that her customers place in advance. She waits on her customers with the friendliness and charisma that she is known for. She will use this loan for 1,500 PEN to buy meters of different types of fabric in different colors, instruments that she uses like scissors, large spools of different colors of thread, needles for sewing and for the machine, pins, and buttons. Ysolina now feels like a very fulfilled woman who has a great desire to achieve and make the rest of her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also for helping so many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meters of fabric, needles, and pins

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 35 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.Mechita, como le dicen de cariño, decidió vender sus refrigerios, hace 07 años atrás, en un Colegio cercano de su casa. Todas los días a partir de las 10:00 am, ella se dirige a vender en el colegio y sus principales clientes son los docentes y alumnos. Mechita, se levanta a las 5:00 am a preparar sus refrigerios y no tiene ninguna dificultad de hacerlo, de esta manera, podrá sacar adelante a su pequeña niña, ya que es una mujer sola, que a pesar de las dificultades y tropiezos que le dio la vida, nunca se rindió y continuo trabajando.  Hoy en día, es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio Restaurante, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the Los Rosales Communal Bank in the San José de Sisa district, El Dorado province, San Martín department. She 35, separated, and has two children. One child is still dependent upon her. Seven years ago Mechita, as she is affectionately called, decided to sell refreshments at a school near her house. From 10:00 a.m. on she sells everyday at the school. Her primary customers are teachers and students. Mechita gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare the refreshments. She does not have any problems doing this. This is the way she can get her small daughter ahead because Mechita is alone. In spite of the difficulties and the obstacles life has given her, she never gives up. She continues working. Now she is very well known and very well received. She personally waits on her customers with the charisma she is known for. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy supplies for daily food preparation like kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oils, sacks of potatoes, crates of chickens, and vegetables. She will also buy some utensils to use in her business and to give her customers better attention. She feels full of life, and she has the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals for her life, like setting up her own well-equipped restaurant. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her food

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали Худойбердиев проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Курбонали более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Кредитуется повторно. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Kurbonali H. lives in the Yavan region. He is 40 years old. He is married and has six children. Kurbonali has been doing animal husbandry for more than five years. He feeds and sells large cattle. This is his second loan. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is fondly called ”Elena” by her co-villagers. She lives in Parog-Parog Solana Cagayan. Magdalena is a widow and mother with four children to support. Three of her children are currently attending a local school in their community and the other is still too young for school. She is a farmer who manages two hectares of rice field. This business allows her to save for the education of her children.

Magdalena plants rice and some vegetables on her rice field twice a year. She needs additional capital and has decided to borrow PHP 15,000.00 through KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her crop production. 

With her patience and sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP 25,000 per harvest season. She uses this to meet the needs her children and to pay her debts. Magdalena hopes that she can produce more rice and vegetables to earn more income.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy farm supplies needed for farming

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa J. is currently in the business of selling beans and bread and is requesting a loan to stock more beans to sell.  Hawa is 35 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es: La señora Leocadia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Leocadia, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y nos comenta que le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y segura de si misma. También Leocadia se dirige, a los pueblos aledaños, a ofrecer su mercadería de ropas.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. Ella manifiesta que esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.Agradece la oportunidad que le ha dado y sigue dando el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos, de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Leocadia belongs to the Las Rosales Communal Bank in the San José de Sisa district, Dorado province, San Martín department. She is 50, separated, and has four grown and independent children. Leocadia is a happy, perseverant, and capable person. She sells clothes. She tells us that it is going very well for her. She now has customers who know her and her business. The strength and perseverance that characterize her helped her to grow as an independent woman who is sure of herself. Leocadia also goes to nearby towns to sell clothes. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy more clothes to stock her inventory. She will buy things like pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and styles, shirts, and dresses for adults and children. She is very proud of what she has achieved, and she did it with much enthusiasm and optimism. She is grateful for the opportunity that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos gave and continues to give her. Having the loans helps her to develop as a woman and as an entrepreneur with a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty B. has been in the retail produce business for 8 years and has so far received a total of 26 loans. She is 43 years old and married with four children all enrolled in school.

Betty would like to use her loan to purchase more produce. She currently generates 50,000 USH in profits per week from her business activity but believes that with increased amounts of produce she can increase that amount. She believes that her personal determination combined with a strong customer base will allow for her continued success.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y es madre de 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Lidia, se dedica a la Venta de mercería, pasamanería y mercadería de ropas. Lleva 13 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad. Se inicio con un capital de S/. 1,500.00 y poco  a poco, ha ido creciendo en su negocio, hoy en día es una gran empresaria y administra su propio negocio, sin dar cuentas a nadie. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y en su barrio, ya es muy conocida por sus clientes y sus ventas diarias son muy buenas. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará mercadería de ropas, zapatos, sandalias y zapatillas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, también comprará hilos para tejer, manteles para mesas. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de plásticos, ollas, platos y medicinas. Lidia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, cada día amanece con muchas ganas seguir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. Manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to Los Rosales Communal Bank in the San José de Sisa district, Dorado province, San Martín department. She is 39, in a common law marriage, and has three children who are still dependent upon her. Lidia sells notions, tassels, and clothing merchandise. She has been doing this for 13 years. She started with 1,500 PEN. Little by little her business has been growing. Now she is a great entrepreneur who runs her own business without relying on anyone else. She currently continues with the same business in her neighborhood. She is very well known by her customers, and her daily sales are very good. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy merchandise like clothes, shoes, sandals, and slippers for women, men, and children. She will also buy plastic, pots, plates, and medicines. Lidia is a fighter and a hard-working woman. Each day she gets up with a lot of desire to get ahead for her family’s well being. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman, and for also supporting other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastics and tassels

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phaste at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies of groundnut to  make phaste to sell.  

Keji is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a grinding mill and locate it at the market for easy access to customers. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of groundnut to make phaste to sell

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es: La señora Loydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 32 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Loydith, se dedica a la venta de Juanes y para venderlos, Loydith, se dirige todas las tardes, por su barrio y reparte a sus vecinos, amigos o familiares. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios de plástico para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus juanes.

loans.name: Karen Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Karen Vanessa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 20 años y 01 pequeño hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Karen Vanessa, es una mujer que ha a su edad, ha logrado salir adelante. Karen, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de las diferentes líneas como: Esika, CyZone y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Karen Vanessa, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karen Vanessa belongs to the “Los Rosales” community bank, located in the San José de Sisa district, province of Dorado, department of San Martín. She’s married, 20 years old and has a small dependent child. For a woman her age, Karen Vanessa has been successful. Karen sells cosmetics from different brands including Esika, CyZone and Avon and continues to do so now. With this loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy beauty products for her inventory including perfumes for women and men, creams, pressed powder compacts, lip pencils, nail polish as well as another display case to present her products. Karen Vanessa is an example for other women to follow to see how to start a business and persevere in order to pursue one’s dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her own business and helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Deus' Group

texts.en: Deus B. is married with three children, all enrolled in school, and is the leader of his group in Ntungamo. He has been operating a retail shop for 4 years and would like to use this loan (his 3rd) to expand his operations. He is determined and hardworking and hopes that his business will continue to grow in the future, allowing him to lead a prosperous life.

loans.use: more inventory

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 42 years of age, married and blessed with three children. Her children are presently in school and taking their studies. Remedios S. has been in this business for ten years. Her business is the retailing of goods in her general store at their village of San Rafael, Aurora, Isabela. The familys main source of income is farming, planting rice in their fields and planting vegetables in their backyard. The profits from her business are being used to improve her business and her family’s savings for the future and emergencies.

Her husband is busy with their farming activities. Remedios wishes to expand her business to earn additional income of the family. If she adds more items of goods in her store, she will also earn a bigger profit. She is asking to borrow the amount of Php 12,000 in additional capital for her business through the KIVA lenders. She believes that her dreams will someday be achieve .

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell from her store

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina J. is 40 years old and married to a policeman. She has five children, two of whom go to school. Justina is currently in the business of brewing and selling alcohol, and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials, such as pipes, yeast, etc. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a bar at the market and purchase crates of beer to sell.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials, such as pipes, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing M. is a 34 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province, where she earns a living as a local farmer. She is married to Mr. Keo Yeam, (picture) age 40, who works with her in the farming business. The family have three school-aged and three married children. Hing M. has grown her rice crop for a month ago, but her crop is not growing well due to it is required more fertilizers. Because the obstacle, Hing M. has requested a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji L.  is currently in the business of selling shorgum and maize flour and is requesting a loan to stock more shorgum and maize to sell.  Keji is 45 years old and is Widowed.   She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more shorgum and maize to sell

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita B. is from the village of P-3, Upper Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 43 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Nerlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for her business comes from selling bamboo products in the local community. Nerlita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nerlita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nerlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima J. is 49 years old and widowed. She has four school-aged children. Alima is currently in the business of selling charcoal from home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to buy foodstuffs for home consumption.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes C. is 37 years old and married to a soldier. She has seven school-aged children. Agnes is currently in the business of selling sugar and charcoal, and is requesting a loan to improve her stock. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To improve her stock of charcoal and sugar

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla D. is from the village of Camanga,Tukuran. She is 59 years old.Perla is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living,Perla D. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.Perla has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 11,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007,Perla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure.Perla  is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by  from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Leonard's Group

texts.en:
N. Leonard is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a 36-year-old widow with two children of her own, and she also takes care of two dependents. For the past five years Leonard has been in the business of selling agricultural produce from Bwagonga trading centre. She is able to make 100,000 UGX weekly profit and this enables her to take care of her children, including paying their school fees.

Leonard dreams of becoming the largest supplier of agricultural produce, especially green bananas, thus enabling her to make more profit and provide her children with the very best education. Leonard needs a loan to buy more produce for resale, since loans help her offer a variety of produce.

loans.use: To buy more produce to expand variety

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia P. is currently in the business of selling beer and charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Lucia is 22 years old and is Single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market and buy fridges for keeping beer fresh and cold.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: La señora Ana Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 64 años y 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.Su espíritu luchador y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de empanadas, ubicada en su misma, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 1:00 de la tarde. Lleva 04 año trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos como harina preparada y aceites en paquetes, mantequilla, sal, huevos, aceituna y algunos condimentos para dar un rico sabor a sus empanadas, como también  utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Ana Margarita, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que realiza  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita belongs to the community bank “Alfonso Ugarte” in the Tarapoto District, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 64 years old and single with four children, all of whom now live on their own. Her fighting spirit and desire to get ahead by her own means have led her to start her own business selling empanadas. She sells them from a well-equipped area where, little by little, she has made herself known among customers. She tells us she is doing very well with her business. She begins selling empanadas at 1:00 in the afternoon. She has had her store for four years and feels very happy with what she does. With this loan of 3000 soles, Ana Margarita will buy ingredients like prepared flour, packaged oil, butter, salt, eggs, olive, and various condiments to add a rich flavor to her empandas. She will also use it to buy cooking utensils so that she offer high-quality service. Ana Margarita is calm and content with what she does. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her achieve her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette L. is from the village of Camanga,Tukuran. She is 30 years old. Bernadette is married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Bernadette owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bernadette joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Bernadette from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose J. is currently in the business of selling ice cream and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge for making more ice cream to sell.  Rose is 26 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant in the Heineken company. They have 5 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Rose hopes to be able to open up a shop. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 41 year single mother of six children aged between 9 and 19 years. All her children go to school .She resides and rents a one roomed house where she stays with five people  Monica takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Monica works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She owns a retail shop on Lubaga road Social center zone. Monica buys her merchandise from Kikuubo one of the busiest places in Kampala city.  She pays transport costs to and from shopping. She is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of merchandise   hence a reduction in no of customers she receives each day.  Her residence also acts as her business premises .Monica  sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale and works seven days a week  She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop like bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a whole sale shop.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar boxes of soap and cartons of salt

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon T. is 61 years old and a resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She currently sells natural medicine to earn a living. The medicine is made from many kinds of root trees. She normally buys the root from the people who carved from the forest and then she makes the medicine them and sells it to patients. She earn an average of $4 per day, and she has been in the business more than four years. Chhuon T. has three children; two of them are married and the other one is single, who works for a garment factory. Chhuon T. said that her family living conditions are not so comfortable, because her house often cracks down during the falling heavy rains. To solve this obstacle, she is looking for a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita B. is from the village of Brgy. Santiago, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Margarita is married and has 6 school-age children. To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Margarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Zenab

texts.en:
Zenab M. is 21 years old and married. Her husband is a business man. They have 3 children who go to school. Zenab owns a taxi that carries passengers from one area to another area within Juba town. She  is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts and more fuel.  With the extra profits from her loan, Zenab hopes to be able to buy another taxi that will always carry passengers from Juba to Torit town in the east of Southern Sudan.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education,  human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and more fuel

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. is a 35 year old married woman with three children ages 12 to 16 years. All her children go to school .She owns a two room house where she stays with five people.  Florence also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Florence works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  She owns a restaurant on Lubaga road and buys her raw food from the Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.  She pays transport costs to and from shopping. Florence is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of food  due to persistent droughts faced by many areas of Uganda. Florence sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale and works six days a week  She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same groupmates. She wants to use this new loan to buy more raw food and sacks of charcoal for her restaurant.  She has hope of seeing her business grow bigger and of owning an established home.

loans.use: To buy more raw food for her restuarant

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina M. is happily married to Meshack Muli and they are blessed with one child, Richard Kiyeti, who is in class 1. Before joining KADET, Paulina had been in the business of selling clothes for two years. She was introduced to KADET by a customer who is a KADET client, and who later introduced her to the group she is now in.

Her business is located in the town centre popularly known as Kandara Shops - Mwembe Tayari. Here the level of business activity is high and she reaps a profit from it. She has applied for her first loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings; 30,000 shillings will be used to purchase clothing stock and the remaining 5,000 for the cost of transport from the Malaba border where she purchases her stock.

In the future Paulina hopes to become a leading supplier of clothing and food.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Herenia

texts.en:
Herenia is 59 years old and married. Her husband is Eduardo B., and they have three children. Peter, 38, works as domestic helper, Mercy, 32, is a teacher, and Mary Jane, 30, is an employee. They are presently residing at San Pablo, Alicia, a rural area, and their house is located near a fish pond.

Herenia has managed a wholesale business for almost five years, selling fish sauce and vinegar. Also, she has been a fish vendor for almost seven years. She is applying for a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP 13,000 to provide additional capital for her business. She plans to expand her business to increase her income, and hopes that KIVA will grant her loan as much as possible so that she can better support her family's financial situation.

loans.use: Additional capital for her wholesale business

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mr. Sin S. lives in Trapeang Reang village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Kuoy Rin, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they earn only a small income to support their household. In order to improve the family living, Mr. Sin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver. He is 44 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one being too young to work or study. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: La señora  Jessica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Jessica, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos y ahora cuenta con un Salón de Belleza, muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en la parte céntrica de la Ciudad.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,300.00, comprará productos de belleza para su como: tinte, oxigeno, shampo, cremas, gorros térmicos, tijera, navajas, ganchos, entre otros y así brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.Jessica con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Jessica belongs to the “Alfonso Ugarte” Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province, in the San Martín region of Peru. She is 34 years old and lives with her partner and 2 dependent children.
Jessica is a woman who has managed to overcome many difficulties in her life. Her desire to succeed has paid off and she is very happy in the business she now runs. She started out selling cosmetics and now owns a well-fitted beauty salon located in the city centre.
With this 2,300 PEN loan, she will buy beauty products like dye, oxygen, shampoo, creams, heating caps, scissors, razors, pins, among others, to provide her customers with good service.
With all her experience, Jessica is a role model for many women just starting a business, who, with perseverance, realize their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and for helping others grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome M. is  39 years old and happily married to a Sergeant in the Kenyan military. She is a mother of two, Mwokofu who is in class six and Kasele who is in class two.

Salome has a contract to transport plastics from Mombasa to Nairobi and does it twice per month. She has been in this business for 6 years. Salome is accessing her first loan from KADET and she intends to purchase more stock and to transport stock to Nairobi.

One day, she hopes to become a manufacturer of plastics in Mombasa city.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more stock of plastics and to transport them to Nairobi.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is from Brgy. Santiago, Iligan City. She is 35 years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nass' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nass S. is a group leader of four members who all live in Bang Bat village in Takeo province. She is 40 years old and single with two sisters. She is a weaver and now she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living with this loan. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Muthoni

texts.en:
Muthoni W. is 51 years old and happily married with three children, two boys and one girl. All are adults and the last born, Edward, is in his third year at the University. 

She has been in the housing business for fifteen years and her area of specialization is rental housing. She buys plots of land and constructs rental units on them. She says she enjoys this work. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client but in another group. She has applied for her first loan from KADET, and she intends to use the money to drill a well for her tenants at a cost of kshs. 60,000, and the rest will be used to paint the rental rooms.

Her dream is to own first class apartments in the coastal city of Mombasa.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Drill a well for her tenants (for running water) and to paint the rental rooms.

loans.name: Pita

texts.en:
Pita R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread at her home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Pita is 30 years old. Her husband is a businessman. They have four children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store at the nearby market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vangi's Group

texts.en: K. Vangi is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a 42-year-old friendly and cooperative lady with a retail shop business in Ndoragi that she has been running for twenty years. She is happy about her loans because she has been able to increase the business at her shop and now has a variety of products to sell. Vangi is able to make about $85 in profits a week, and this helps to take care of her family. She is married and has five children who are all in school. She wants to see all of them attain the best education available from the best Universities around. Vangi needs a loan to help restock her shop, because this helps her avoid shortages.

loans.use: Restock her retail shop to avoid shortages.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is engaged in poultry business. It has been her main source of income for three years and she is aiming to improve it more for profitability. According to her, her business is doing well even though sometimes it’s hard to budget her income for the needs of her family and her business. 
She hopes to borrow a loan for the amount of PHP12,000 to buy sufficient supply of feeds and to maintain her business. She hopes to avail her loan to be able to provide the needs of their family.
Nida is a very responsible business woman. She is 30 years old and she is happily married to Felimon. The couple has five adult-aged children and most of them are already married. They are living in the peaceful village of Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: to buy sufficient supply of feeds for her  poultry

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: The smiling fact person shown in the picture is Mrs. Mrs. C., 48 years old. She currently makes a living selling fish in the market area. As another income, she raises pigs and fish in a piece of land next to her house. She is married and has eight children; four of them are single and the others are married. To help meet a little more of their family's food expenses, four of her children are employed in different jobs. While her husband, aged 49, is in the Cambodia Military, as well as being a domestic land trader. Recently, C. is required more supplies for her business, so that she requests a loan of US$1200. She will be used her loan to purchase small fish, piglet, and animal food for raising.

loans.use: To purchase small fish, piglet, and animal food for raising

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle T. is from the village of Danao. She is 37 years old. Anabelle is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Anabelle owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
