loans.name: Akhere

texts.en: Akhere is 32 years old and married with a child. She sells salon materials and she also makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials to sell

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 26 years old and is married with two children aged 5 and 10 years, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Madina works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a shop where she does her laundry work. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. She cleans all types of clothing and bedding, plus carpets. She charges from 300/= to 2,000/=, depending on the size and dirtiness. She works seven days a week.

Madina is faced with the challenge of an increasing number of competitors in the area. She has been in this business for nine years and with MCDT for two years. She is servicing her fourth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy a secondhand washing machine and jerrycans of liquid soap.

Madina is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and become a laundry company, employing other people.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand washing machine and jerrycans of liquid soap

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa B. is a 44-year-old woman from Tala, Caloocan City. Her family lives among the poor communities in a village named Malaria. She has eight children with her husband, Fernando, who is a carpenter. Teresa never seems to get tired in managing her businesses. She has a sari-sari (general) store and a play station where large video-karaoke machines and game consoles are for hire. With these businesses, Teresa makes a net monthly income of P14,000. She uses her profits to support the basic daily needs of the family, especially her children’s education. Upon her friend’s invitation, and out of curiosity, Teresa attended an orientation conducted for women entrepreneurs, sometime in 2008, by staff from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P10,000. which she will use to purchase more items to sell at her store. A portion of the loan proceeds will be used for her daughter’s college education. She dreams of seeing her store someday grow as big as the city’s supermarkets. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell at her store

loans.name: God Will Provide - Red Hill Group

texts.en:
God Will Provide - Red Hill Group is a group of five borrowers led by Musu G..

Musu is 59 years old and is married with three children aged 20 to 32 years old, with educational levels of 10th grade through high school graduate. Musu is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live on the Red Hill field, Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lots. It is situated north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Musu's business is selling general goods like milk, rice, candles, bath soap, detergents, body lotions, etc. She buys them wholesale and sells retail to local residents. She has been running this business for eighteen years and hopes to establish a bigger shop in the future. Musu’s prices are lower than other vendors and she sells quality products to her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Musu faces difficulties during the rainy season because, when it rains, people don't come out to buy. She needs this loan in order to purchase more general goods to sell.

Musu dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda D. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Brenda is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Brenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Brenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en:
Ibragim is married with three children. He lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan and runs a store selling carpets of different kinds and tastes. His business is very prospective and flourishing. Ibragim has an individual approach to each of his customers which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 5 years. Currently he needs a loan of $3000 USD to expand the range of his selling business. Ibragim is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. Ibragim’s business is developed and settled. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda M., is 67 years old and married to Jorge M., who is a retired hospital employee. Since Jorge receives a small pension from his former job, he now helps Florenda in her food-vending business so that they can earn a little more. The couple have five children who are 34 to 43 years old, and have finished their training in their chosen fields: one is an electrician, another graduated from a nautical course, another finished a nursing course, and one is a midwife. One of her children works abroad and sends some money to help support the family; all the others are also gainfully employed and also help their parents in one way or another. But Florenda and her husband Jorge do not want to be a financial burden to their children and want to retain some sort of independence. This is why they are striving hard to make their business a success in spite of their advanced age. Having a business also keeps them busy and alert. Years ago, Florenda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access capital so that she could help her husband increase the family income, especially so that they could afford the school tuition of their children. When she got her first loan of Php 5,000, she invested it by putting up a general store. As she was able to increase her loan amounts at each new cycle, she also expanded the operations of her general store and widened the line of products she offered to her customers. To earn a large amount, enough to pay for tuition fees, she also engaged in hog-raising and sold the pigs just in time to pay for the college tuition of her children. Patience, hard work and dedication to achieve her dreams is the key to Florenda’s success, success in the sense that all of her children were able to finish college and earn their degrees. Now that her children are already gainfully employed and are starting to help her financially, she is taking things a little bit easier and is concentrating more on food-vending, selling sweet potato, cassava, bananas, bread and hotdogs from her home. She earns a monthly income of PHP 4,000 from this business activity. In her previous loan, Florenda borrowed Php 16,000 as additional working capital for her business, and her loan was fully paid on time and in full, without any delays. Now, for her 11th loan, she is to borrowing Php 18,000 to be used to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her food preparation business

loans.name: John M.'s Group

texts.en:
This is a cross section of the teachers from the Mathora Secondary School for Girls. The Mathora Secondary school is situated in Magburaka and is one of the oldest secondary schools in northern Sierra Leone. It is a boarding school and currently enrolls 930 pupils. Since its inception in 1959, several of the country’s female dignitaries have passed through this school – ministers, lawyers, doctors, nurses, teachers, police officers and so on. Today, as a result of the new educational system being introduced by the Ministry of Education called the 6334 (i.e. six years in primary school, three years in Junior secondary school, three years in Senior secondary school and four years in university), the school is being divided into a senior and junior secondary schools with two principals running each one of the schools.

In 1998, the rebel invasion of the town of Magburaka left the school in ruins – buildings, staff quarters and dormitories were damaged. Laboratory equipment was destroyed, especially in the home economics and biology departments. Because of the invasion, the students and staff were forced to flee to Freetown to the Richard Allen High School, where they sought refuge until 2003.  After a peace treaty between the rebels and the government was reached in 2002, they were able to return to Magburaka.

With funds from the United Nations and the European Union, the once-mutilated school has been rehabilitated. UNICEF refurnished the laboratories with new equipment. The school is up-and-running once again, but the scar left by the rebels still remains – many of the teachers are not willing to return to the remote village of Mathora and a host of them have decided to remain in Freetown, where living conditions are bit better to that of the Mathora village. There are only a few who are willing to return and are determined to help the pupils of Magburaka and its environs.

Additionally, the teaching profession is one of the least preferred professions in Sierra Leone because salaries are not very attractive. Those who have found themselves in the profession usually are forced to seek other ways of earning more income to supplement their salaries. Many of them either engage in petty trading, in agriculture or in organizing extra classes (a practice the Sierra Leone government is trying to stop) in an effort to make additional money. 

Some of the teachers from Mathora have requested the loan for purposes of expanding their businesses.  Others will use their loans to give to their wives, who may already be businesswomen. It is out of their wives’ businesses that they generate additional income and assist a great deal in the running of their respective households. Furthermore, some of the teachers will be using the loan for either a building project or in buying pieces of furniture – a piece of furniture which they would not normally be able to buy on their current salary. Finally, some will use their loan either to pay school fees and other related charges for their children or pursue further studies themselves.

John M. B. (on the left) is a senior teacher at the school and head of this group. He has been a teacher for eighteen years. John was born in a place call Rotufunk, in southern Sierra Leone. He is forty-eight years old, married to a businesswoman and they have three children. One of their child is attending secondary school and the others are in primary schools. This is the third loan John and others in the group have received from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With his first loan, he was able to pursue a masters degree coarse, with the second loan, he bought a piece of land. And with this loan, Mr. B. will use it to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, iron robs and bags of cements.

loans.use: Buy house building materials like iron robs, corrugated iron zincs and cements

She has just applied for a new loan of P25,000 to purchase more stock for her store. This will be her 11th loan with CCT. Alicia dreams of owning a bigger grocery store. texts.fr: B. Adjihoutou est née le 01/01/1966 à Sèmè-Podji. Adjihoutou est mariée à DOSSOU Mondji, un chauffeur. Adjihoutou et Mondji ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Pk10 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podj. Adjihoutou vend des produits vivriers principalement le maïs ainsi que du bois de chauffage. C'est à Pobè et Kétou, deux localités du Département du Plateau que Adjihoutou s'approvisionne en ses différents produits. Adjihoutou a déjà sept ans d'expérience dans son activité et a eu aussi trois crédits, bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Adjihoutou sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle.

loans.name: Naimdjon

texts.en:
A. Naimdjon is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children. He has always been a hard worker, someone who started at an early age helping his mother with her clothing business and contributing his earnings to the family from the time he was young. 

When Naimdjon married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his father, he started his own clothing sales business and his wife helped him in her spare time. His business has grown little by little but he wants to continue to grow in order to improve his quality of life. 

Naimdjon is asking for a 5000 Somoni loan to buy inventory so that he can continue to increase his business. Naimdjon and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of men's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru: Иноятова Мехриниссо проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 52 года. Вдова, имеет 3 детей. По специальности Мехриниссо более 30 лет проработала учителем таджикского языка. Помимо этого она более 10 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Mehrinisso I. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 52 and widowed with three children. For more than 30 years, Mehrinisso was a Tajik language teacher. In addition to this job, for over 10 years, she has been raising livestock, fattening the animals for resale. Mehrinisso is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
H. Karomat is 47 is years old. She is widow and mother of three children. Karomat is working hard to ensure the best future for her children. Karomat has been running her own small business for 12 years already. She has a place in the central local market for selling foodstuff such as sugar, tea, sweets, eggs and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. The business is stable that allows her to improve the level of living condition of her family. Now Karomat needs a loan of 10000 Somoni for increasing the range of her selling goods. Karomat and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Amaka sells cosmetics to earn a living and to meet the needs of her family. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Kobavi Ahoueffa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants ; depuis 2000, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes de qualité, des produits génériques, certains articles scolaires et certains ustensiles de cuisine comme les cuillères, les fourchettes, les couteaux. Elle dispose d’un petit espace à côté d’un super marché dans le quartier de Djidjolé à Lomé où elle vend ses produits. La plupart des clients visitant le supermarché en profitent à leur sortie, de jeter un coup d’œil sur ses produits. Elle réalise en ce moment de bonnes affaires puisqu’elle revend aussi les pagnes à des revendeuses ambulantes, qui viennent s’approvisionner chez elle. Pour disposer d’un nouveau stock, elle sollicite urgemment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 pagnes Wax Hollandais, 05 pagnes Hitarget, 05 pagnes Soso ainsi que certains articles scolaires manquants et des ustensiles de cuisine.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of two children.  In 2000, she started doing commerce in quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth), generic pharmaceutical products, certain school supplies, and certain kitchen utensils, such as spoons, forks, and knives.  She has a small spot next to a supermarket in the Djidjolé district of Lomé where she sells her goods.  Most of her customers visiting the supermarket have a look at her goods and take advantage of them upon exiting the store.  Right now, business is good, since she also resells pagnes to hawkers who come to her to stock up.  To obtain new inventory, she's urgently requesting a WAGES loan to buy 10 Wax Hollandais pagnes, 5 Hitarget pagnes, 5 Soso pagnes, as well as certain lacking school supplies and some kitchen utensils. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" cloth

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en:
Ibrogim is married with 6 children. He is a private entrepreneur selling carpet. His business is well known in the market and he has a good distribution network. Ibrogim has been in this business since 1983. He has a good credit history with IMON International being our client for more than 4 years. Today Ibrogim is requesting a loan of $3000 to expand the range of carpets and attract more customers to his venture. Ibrogim is very energetic and determined. He is a true businessman motivated by achievement. We believe his character and hard work will help him not only set high goals but also reach them through application of his versatile skills. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 38 years old, married and has six children aged between 07 and 16 years. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with six people  Prossy takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Prossy works in semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.  She owns a  food stall selling bananas, avocado, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home and only pays a local licensing  fee. 

Prossy is faced with the challenge of increasing prices for food supplies and customer defaults.  Prossy sells to all categories of people and receives about 20 customer’s a day.  Prossy works seven days a week and has been in this food stall business for ten years. She has been working with the same loan group for eight months where she is servicing her second loan with MCDT. She wants to use this loan to buy more food supplies for her stall

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for her food stall; like sacks of bananas, boxes of tomatoes and onoins

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une diplômée d’une école de formation professionnelle ; en effet, elle est titulaire d’un diplôme d’agent de développement. Malheureusement, elle n’a pas eu la chance d’être employée par une institution classique ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est lancée en 2005 dans la gestion d’une activité génératrice de revenu, en exerçant le commerce d’habits pour enfants ainsi que des produits de beauté comme les boucles d’oreille, les perles et bijoux. Elle exerce cette activité dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle est fière de cette nouvelle opportunité dans laquelle elle réussit à bien gagner sa vie. Elle souhaite renouveler son stock en baisse ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des habits pour enfants et des produits de beauté. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This woman is a graduate of a professional training school; she actually has a degree as a Development Officer. Unfortunately, she has not had the chance to be employed by a traditional institution; it is for this reason that, in 2005, she began managing her own income-generating activity by seling children's clothing as well as beauty products such as earrings, pearls, and jewelry. She runs this business at the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé. She is proud of this new opportunity through which she has been able to make a living successfully. She hopes to replenish her diminished stock; it is for this that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy children's clothing and beauty products. She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Esther S.'s Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of a Vocational Institute, in Tonkolili District, northern Sierra Leone. This institution is geared towards the development of the girl child. Their goal is to educate the girl child develop skills that will enable her become self reliant. Thus they offer courses like computer science, typing writing, agriculture, tailoring, gara dyeing, hair dressing, catering and clothe weaving. They cater mainly for girls who could not make it in the formal schooling sector.

This will be the third loan these Borrowers are accessing Kiva Lenders through SMT. Previous loans had created significant impacts into the lives of these Borrowers. Some of them invested the loan into their businesses, others used theirs to settle their children’s school affairs and others use theirs to buy themselves pieces of furniture. 

Esther S. K. is the deputy head mistress of this vocation. Esther (on the left) was born in Magburaka town. Esther is forty-five years of age. She is divorced with four children. Two of her children are in primary schools and two in secondary schools. Esther will use this loan to pay school fees and other school related charges for her children.

loans.use: Pay School Fess and other school related charges

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гульнора Аминова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 28 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж занимается бизнесом. Сама Гульнора более 5 лет занимается земледелием. Она в основном выращивает фрукты, а потом продает их на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Gulnora A. lives in the Yavan region. She is 28 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband does business. Gulnora has been in agriculture for more than five years. She mostly grows fruits and then sells them on the market. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds so she can sow new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for harvest

loans.name: Moussa Aboul

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des ruminants et des volailles, en vendant des moutons et des poules. Il a démarré cette activité dans le marché de Gbossimé à Lomé en 1999. Il dispose de longues années expériences dans le domaine et maîtrise parfaitement tous les rouages de cette activité. Il réalise de bonnes affaires pendant les fêtes de fin d’année ou lors d’autres périodes de réjouissances. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Pour acheter d’autres ruminants et volailles, il sollicite urgemment avant les fêtes de fin d’année un crédit de WAGES ; ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 moutons ou béliers et 50 poules.

loans.use: Achat de moutons et de volailles

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells provisions and drinks retail to her customers. She is 40 years old, married with 5 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through to senior high school level. Rose sells second hand clothing at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since 2000. Her husband is a trader. Rose uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of the family. Rose will use the loan to purchase more second hand clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save to further her children's education.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Our Help From God Group

texts.en:
Our Help From God is a group of five borrowers led by Gbesay B.. Gbesay is 39 years old and married with three children aged 13-23 years old in education levels from 4th-10th grade.

Gbesay is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live on the Red Hill Field in Virginia, a newly built community north of Liberia's capital of Monrovia for poor people who can't afford to buy town lots.

Gbesay's business is selling foodstuffs like onions, potato leaf, peppers, garden eggs, etc. She buys them wholesale from farmers and sells on a retail basis in the Dualla market north of Monrovia. She has been running this business for 20 years and is hoping to grow her business to a shop in the future.

Because Gbesay depends on her business to pay her children's school fees and for the family's daily needs, she talks to her customers in a good manner and always adds on to her customers' purchases in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Whenever Gbesay pays her children's school fees, it reduces the size of her business. She needs this loan in order to purchase more goods like garden eggs, pepper, potato leaf, etc., in order to improve business. Gbesay dreams of building a second house for her family and educating her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like garden eggs, pepper and potato leaf in order to improve business

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est une revendeuse ambulante de casseroles, de plats ou du verre à boire. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle vend de maison en maison et dispose d’une clientèle qui lui est fidèle et qui préfère les plats ou casseroles à la mode. Elle a de grandes ambitions pour l’avenir et prévoit ouvrir une boutique de vente de ces articles. Elle souhaite s’approvisionner au Grand Marché de Lomé ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de différents plats, casseroles et verres à boire sur commande.

loans.use: Achat de casseroles, plats et verres à boire

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.en: S. Mirzo was born in 1969 in the Kumsangir district, where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has six children. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Mirzo owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of $2,800 to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. The money he is requesting will help guarantee a high-quality harvest for which Mirzo and his entire family are very thankful. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica M. is married and has one child. She has received junior high school education. Her husband is a private diver.

Erica makes and sells palm kernel oil; she buys palm nuts and process them to produce palm oil at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since 2008. Erica uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of the family.

Erica will use the loan to purchase more bags of palm kernel to process into oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Erica plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm kernel to process into oil

loans.name: Tchapo B.

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert en 2003 dans le quartier de Nukafu à Lomé une boutique de vente de trousseaux pour enfants ; en effet, elle vend des chaussures, des biberons, des chemisettes pour enfants et bébés. Elle a épousé un cadre commercial qui l’oriente et la conseille dans la gestion de cette boutique, rare dans le coin. Elle réalise de bonnes affaires ces temps-ci et prévoit vendre plus pour les fêtes de fin d’années. Pour disposer d’un stock à la mode, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des chaussures de qualité, des chemisettes et robes pour enfants ainsi que des biberons à la mode. Elle est mère de 02 enfants et pense que ce prêt apportera un changement positif dans l’évolution de son commerce
texts.en:
In 2003, this lady opened a store selling children's clothing in the Nukafu area of Lomé; in fact, she sells shoes, baby bottles, and light shirts for children and babies. She is married to a business executive who guides and counsels her in the management of her store, which is unusual in this area. She generates a good income these days and foresees selling even more for the festivals at the end of the year. To establish a stock of fashionable items, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy high quality shoes, shirts, and dresses for children, as well as baby bottles currently in fashion. She is the mother of two children and believes that this loan will bring positive change to the development of her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing for babies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells akara (beans cake).The demands for her akara is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more bags of bean to fry akara to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of bean to fry akara to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua S. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Efua sells powdered pepper; she goes to the market and buys fresh peppers, dries them and blends them into powder to sell in Elmina near Ayensudo. She has been selling powdered pepper since 2008. Her husband is a poultry farmer.  

Efua uses her income to support the upkeep of the family. Efua will use the loan to buy more peppers to ground into powder to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to further her children's education.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to buy more peppers to ground into powder to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Barra Puntod. Lourdes is just starting this business.

In 2001, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 20,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be Lourdes's 15th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has three children. She has no educational background.  Ekua sells powdered pepper: she goes to the market and buy fresh pepper dries them and blends them into powder to sell at Elmina, which she has been doing since 2007. Her husband is a farmer.  Ekua uses her income to support the husband in the upkeep of the family.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase more pepper to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, IKEA plans to save to reinvest.

loans.use: Ekua will use the loan to purchase more pepper to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa sells motor spare parts. She is 28 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motor parts to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. sells maize and gari (roasted cassava). She buys them in sacks and sells in smaller quantities at Elmina near Ayensudo. She has been selling maize and gari since 2003.

Ama is divorced and has two children. She is responsible for the paying of bills and school fees. She has no educational background.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy more sacks of gari and maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of gari and maize to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. makes and sells palm kernel oil: she buys palm nuts and processes them to get her oil at Elmina near Atabadze. Sarah has no educational background.  She is married and has five children .Her husband is a carpenter. Sarah has been selling palm kernel oil since 2004. She supports in the payment of school fees and upkeep of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm kernel to process into oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more palm kernel to process into oil.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old. Paulina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Paulina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paulina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Paulina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Paulina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер Кукузов проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет  3 детей. Жена работает в колхозе. Алишер по специальности "механик". Но по специальности не работал. Кукзов имеет собственный магазин, в котором занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. Т.к. Алишер является повторным клиентом, у него в ассортименте появились хоз. товары. В этот раз кредит просит для закупа муки, т.е. расширение ассортимента.

loans.use: Увеличение ассортимента

loans.name: Prescillia

texts.en: Pescillia is a farmer. She plants cassava and plantain on her farm. She is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cassava stems to plant. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava stems to plant

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris le métier de soudure ; c’est pour cela qu’en 2001, elle a ouvert son atelier de soudure dans le quartier de Kegué à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Des clients viennent aussi commander chez lui des portes métalliques ainsi que d’autres produits. Il est aussi spécialisé dans la tôlerie des gros camions et engins. Il voudrait en ce moment avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des tôles, du carbure et du gaz pour continuer ses activités de soudure. Beaucoup de clients apprécient la franchise, l’honnêteté et la qualité de ses travaux ou prestations de services.
texts.en:
This gentleman is trained as a welder; it is for this reason that in 2001 he opened a welding workshop in the Kegué district of Lomé. This business allows him above all to provide for his wife and two children. His customers also come to him to order metal gates as well as other products. He also specializes in the manufacture of sheet metal for large trucks and vehicles. Currently, he would like to obtain a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy sheet metal, carbide, and gas to continue his welding activities. Many customers appreciate his sincerity, honesty, and the quality of his goods and services.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheet metal, carbide, and gas

loans.name: Wilber Alexander

texts.es: Wilber Alexander A. L.  reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad, con tan solo 23 años de edad Wilber ya es padre de una hermosa niña de 2 años de edad llamada Alison, con el también vive su esposa quien se dedica al hogar. Como muchos hombres Wilber es el único que da todo el aporte económico al hogar, por medio de su negocio una venta de huevos  la cual maneja hace cinco años, Wilber tiene muchos clientes frecuente que le conocen por la buena calidad de sus huevos. El crédito que solicita Wilber es para comprar mayor cantidad de huevos en diversos tamaños y precios,  según los gustos y posibilidades de sus clientes

loans.use: comprar mayor cantidad de huevos

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is married and has two children. She has received education through senior high school. Her husband is a pensioner.

Victoria sells goods such as onions and groundnuts (peanuts) at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since 2008. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Victoria will use the loan to buy more onions, groundnuts and other food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, She plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more onions, groundnuts and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is Mohamed S., a small scale businessman in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. He is seeking a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help him improve his business quality and size. Mohamed sells slippers/flip-flops. With this loan, he will be able to buy more bales of slippers/flip-flops of different qualities to add to his stock. In this way, he will be able to attract many more customers into his businesses, makes more sales and earns more profit. Subsequently, he will be in a better position to look after himself and family.

Mohamed was born in a place called Malal Mara, in Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have eight children between the ages of one – twenty five. Mohamed has been selling shoes for twenty-three years now and prior to this, he was selling ready-to-wear-clothes. 

Mohamed will invest this loan into his slippers business. He buys the slippers in Freetown. Prices for a bale of slippers varies, some are sold at Le 72,000, others at Le 80,000 and others at Le 1,000,0000.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en:
Jesus Is Lord Group is a group of five borrowers led by Tawa J..

Tawa is 32 years old and married with three children aged 2 to 15 years old with educational levels of 4th through 8th grade. She is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family lives on the Red Hill Field in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lots. It is located north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Tawa's business is selling cigarettes, matches, peppermint candies, chewing gum, candles, biscuits (cookies), etc. She buys them wholesale and sells retail to residents on a table beside her home. She has been running this business for eight years. She sells good products and talks to customers with a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Tawa face difficulties during the rainy season because when it rains, no business goes on because she doesn't have shelter for her business. She needs this loan in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Tawa hopes to establish a shop in the future. She dreams of improving the living standard of herself and her family and building another house for them.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: María Eusebia

texts.es: María Eusebia F. D. M. resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador  junto a su esposo y su hija. María y su esposo luchan día a día para lograr el sustento diario, ambos trabajan en la elaboración D. tejas hechas D. barro, las cuales son fabricadas D. manera artesanal por esta pareja, en la casa D. María por ser una zona no urbanizada ella tienen a su disposición terreno, el cual sabe aprovechar al máximo con el cultivo D. maíz que después oferta. María ahora solicita D. un crédito para comprar leña, tierra y mejorar su horno, donD. cocina las tejas, D. esta manera logrará tener un producción en tejas más eficiente y D. mayor calidad.

loans.use: comprar leña, tierra y mejorar su horno

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en: Winifred M. is married and has four children. She has received education through junior high school.  Winifred sells maize and yam: she goes to the market and buys maize in sacks and yam in large quantities to sell at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since the year2000. Her husband is a carpenter.  Winifred uses her income to support the husband in the upkeep of the family.  Winifred will use the loan to buy more maize and yam to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Winifred plans to save to further her childrens education.

loans.use: Winifred will use the loan to buy more maize and yam to sell.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth has a fish farm. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fingerlings. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fingerlings

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: María Inés T. reside en San Luis Talpa en el departamento de La Paz. María tiene 63 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo Aldo de 22 años de edad. María es una mujer sorprendentemente trabajadora ha sacado adelante a su hijo con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios, actualmente Maria tiene 29 años de tener su negocio, con el que ha obtenido sostenerse todos estos años atrás, actualmente María solicita de un crédito para reinvertir en su tienda la cual aprecia mucho María y piensa trabarjar muchos años más
texts.en:
Maria Ines T. lives in San Luis Talpa, in the department of La Paz. Maria is 63 years old and she is a single mother who lives with her son, Aldo, who is 22 years old. Maria is a surprisingly hard-working woman and she has raised her son through great effort and sacrifice. She has now been working at her business for 29 years, and she has always supported herself through it. Maria currently needs a loan in order to reinvest in her store, which she appreciates a lot and in which she wishes to work for many more years.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinvest in her store/reinvertir en su tienda

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells groceries in her community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Elena Salome

texts.es: Elena Salome C. D. A. resiD. en Apopa municipio D. San Salvador, junto a sus dos hijos y una nieta. Elena es una mujer separada D. su esposo, ella posee su propio negocio donD. fabrica tamales para luego venderlos D. manera ambulante, Elena posee 25 años D. experiencia en su negocio, el destino del crédito que solicita es para comprar  materia para la elaboración D. tamales.
texts.en:
Elena Salome C. D. A. lives in Apopa, in the county of San Salvador, with her two sons and a granddaughter. Elena is separated from her husband and she has her own business making tamales (a Latin American dish maD. with meat, vegetables and dough, boiled in a banana leaf) which she then sells on the street. Elena has 25 years of experience in this business, and the credit she has asked for will be used to buy ingredients to make tamales.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales/comprar  materia para la elaboración de tamales

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. makes and sells palm kernel oil buys: she palm nuts and processes them to get her oil at Elmina near Atabadze.  Elizabeth has no educational background.  She is married and has four children .Her husband is a carpenter. Elizabeth has been selling palm kernel oil since the year 200. She supports the husband in the upkeep of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm kernel to process into oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete her building.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more palm kernel to process into oil.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca C. H. D. V. D. 47 años D. edad resiD. en el occidente del país en el departamento D. Ahuachapán,  junto a su esposo. Francisca tuvo la iniciativa D. montar un negocio en su casa para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y es así como hace Francisca, ahora ella  posee su negocio una tienda, con cinco años D. dar servicio a sus files clientes, el crédito que hoy ella solicita es para surtir su negocio D. mayor cantidad D. productos.
texts.en:
Francisca C. H. D. V. is 47 years old and lives in the west of the country, in the department of Ahuachapan with her husband. Francisca had the idea to begin a business from home in order to help her husband with the household costs, and this is what she did. Now she has a store, and she has been serving her loyal clientele for five years. The credit that she is asking for today is to stock her business with a greater number of products.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business with a greater number of products/surtir su negocio de mayor cantidad de productos

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin has a cassava farm where he plants cassava and plantain. He is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more cassava stems to plant. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava stems to plant

loans.name: Yessica Liseth

texts.es: Yessica Liseth R. T. reside en Opico en el departamento de La Libertad. Yessica apenas pasa de su mayoría de edad con 19 años ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive solamente con su madre y hermano. Yessica posee un negocio de comida el cual inicio su madre hace 8 años y ahora continúa funcionando en la administración de Yessica. Ahora ella solicita de un crédito para comprar equipos de cocina que le permitan ser mas eficientes en el servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar equipos de cocina

loans.name: Francisca Amanda

texts.es: Francisca Amanda M. D. P. resiD. en Santa Tecla municipio D. La Libertad. Francisca se encuentra casada vive en casa propia con su esposo y tres nietos. Francisca y su esposo son unos abuelos consentidores ambos cuidan D. los niños que tienen que ir a la escuela. Francisca sale a vender todos los días afuera D. casa , venD. pupusas, papas, atoles y otro; a pesar D. ello Francisca también sale a vender ropa a los [pueblos D. manera ambulante, el crédito que solicita es para comprar mas ropa y otros productos D. temporadas para su negocio.

loans.use: comprar mas ropa y otros productos de temporadas para su negocio

loans.name: Benidit

texts.en: Benidit is a farmer. He plants yams, plantain, and cassava on his farm. He is 45 years old and married with 4 children. He is hoping for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase yam seedlings to plant. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yam seedlings

loans.name: Carlos Salvador

texts.es: Carlos Salvador A. reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Carlos de 54 años de edad  vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos  Estefania de 10 años de edad, Álvaro de 8 años y la consentida de la familia Guadalupe de 7 anos. Carlos ha instalo una tienda en su casa la cual lleva unos cuantos meses a flote ya que antes contaban con otro negocio, la urgencia del crédito de Carlos es para comprar productos al por mayor y así lograr mayores márgenes de ganancias.

loans.use: comprar productos al por mayor

loans.name: Dinah's Group

texts.en: B. Dinah is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 32 years old and married with 4 children who are all in school. Dinah is a determined and hard working lady with a retail shop that she started 7 years ago from scratch. The shop is located in Nyarukika trading centre and her dream is to see it grow much bigger. Dinah needs a loan to help with restocking her retail shop with more bean seeds, maize flour, sugar, salt and so on so that she could be able to make more profits out of it. She is so grateful for her loans and she has no hope of ever stopping since she has strong belief that she will succeed with the help from loans.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es: Luisa Marina F. A. reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Luisa tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera de tres niñas. Para Luisa no ha sido fácil salir adelante con sus hijas por la falta e preparación académica se le era difícil encontrar un empleo, es por eso que hace diez años se decido a instalar su negocio donde vende pan, frutas, huevos,. Etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales utilizados en su comida.

loans.use: comprar materiales utilizados en su comida

loans.name: Probe Group

texts.en:
Probe is a group of 2 borrowers led by Elitha Quennan,47 years old married with 3 children aged 13-26 years old and their educational levels 5th grade-freshman in university.She also cares for 2 orphans.
Elitha is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to early marriage.
She and her family lives on the Lawazu Road at the out sketch of Voinjama,the capital of Lofa County,northern Liberia.

Elitha Quennan's business is selling used clothing. She buys wholesale from importers and sells retail in the Voinjama Market, Lofa County, Northern Liberia. She is 47 years old and married with three children, ages 13 to 26 years old, in Grade 5 to a freshman in university. She also cares for two orphans. Elitha is a high school graduate but she could not continue in university due to an early marriage. She lives with her family on the Lawazu Road, on the outskirts of Voinjama, the capital of Lofa County, Northern Liberia.

Elitha has been running her business for eight years and hopes to improve her business. She often faces financial problems with her business due to family responsibilities. She handles her customers with care and gives them better prices in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan in order to purchase used clothes wholesale to improve her business. Elitha dreams of giving her children a better education and preparing them for the future.

Probe is a group of two borrowers led by Elitha Quennan.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes wholesale

loans.name: Julia Angélica

texts.es: Julia Angélica N. reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y su hijo. Julia tiene 44 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, actualmente posee una venta de frutas y verduras donde también surte de un pequeño inventario de ropa, el crédito que solicita es para surtir su negocio del cual obtiene buenas ganancias.

loans.use: surtir su negocio

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 31 year old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Mirna has owned a grocery store since 2002. She sells candies, canned food, home products, soft drinks and juices. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Mirna has requested a loan. 
Mirna is special in her work because she offers a wide range of products. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because at the same time she can continue studying while working. In the future, she plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is 20-year-old engaged woman living with her parents. She has owned a baby clothing shop since 2007 at her town. Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase additional clothes to increase her sales and so her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio C. C. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Juan tiene 45 años de edad vive con su esposa , su hija y la madre. Juan tiene una panadería ubicada en su domicilio, donde fabrica grandes cantidades de pan francés para ser distribuido en la zona, Juan tiene 10 años de estar al frente de su negocio, por el cual hoy solicita de un crédito para invertir en cantidades de materia prima para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio C. C. lives in the town of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. He is 45 years old and lives with his wife, their daughter, and his mother. He operates a bakery out of his home where he makes large quantities of French bread for distribution throughout the area. Juan has been in business for 10 years. He is requesting a loan today to buy large quantities of ingredients to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to increase production

loans.name: Nelly Cecilia

texts.es: La Nelly Cecilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años, 02 hijos que aun dependen D. ella.Nelly Cecilia, por sus ganas D. sacar adelante a su familia  y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora, inicio su propio negocio D. venta D. instrumentos musicales, con un capital D. S/. 1,500.00, ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más instrumentos como guitarra, órganos, flautas, entre otros, igualmente repuestos para la reparación D. instrumentos.Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce y agradece el apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres, que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas, sin depender D. nadie.

loans.use: Comprará repuestos e instrumentos musicales.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es: La señora Rosa Luz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 40 años y 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella. Deseando ver profesional a sus hijas y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, su carácter emprendedor que siempre la caracterizo, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de tortas.Rosa Luz, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus amigos y compañeros de trabajo; y por su buena sazón y acabado, semanalmente le van muy bien.Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: harina de docena, gelatinas por docenas, azúcar, mantequilla, pasas, crema chantillí, colorantes asimismo utensilios de repostería, para brindar un buen servicio.  Rosa Luz, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará ingredientes.

loans.name: María Domitila

texts.es: María Domitila A. A. reside en el oriente del país en San Francisco Gotera municipio del departamento de Morazán. María tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con seis hijos todos aun  menores de edad. Para María ha sido un reto salir adelante con su extensa familia  la cual ha sacado adelante con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo, María se dedica a la venta de variedad de pan de manera ambulante caminado casa por casa lo que ofrece, también vende ropa que comercializa con vecino y amigos, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en nueva mercadería.

loans.use: para invertir en nueva mercadería

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progresando se encuentra en la comunidad de Caja, distrito de Caja,  Provincia de Acobamba, Departamento de Huancavelica.
Esta comunidad se encuentra ubicada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la cual se caracteriza por su agricultura y ganadería.

Una de sus socias es Faustina, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Faustina se dedica a la venta de comida y abarrotes, ayudada por su esposo e hijos. Faustina solicita un préstamo para poder invertirlo en su negocio, comprando mercadería. Faustina, tiene como meta mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello se ha propuesto ahorrar.

Marisa es casada. Marisa tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Marisa comparte la administración de su negocio con su esposo e hijos. Marisa, requiere de un préstamo para  la implementación de su negocio, así como para la compra de mercadería. Marisa, tiene por meta, que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: El Bancomunal Progresando solicita un préstamo de 6,400 soles para que sus 13 socias inviertan en sus negocios

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: La señora Rosalinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 55 años y no tiene hijos.Rosalinda, se dedica a la venta de ropas, lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, donde de poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar y aumentar mas su mercadería. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, ya que diariamente sale a ofrecer sus mercaderías, a sus amigas y conocidos.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas mas mercadería de ropas como: pantalones, snikers, shores, blusas, polos.Rosalinda, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprara mercaderia de ropas.

loans.name: Odilia Magdalena

texts.es: Odilia Magdalena C. D. H. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en El departamento D. Morazán en el municipio D. San Francisco Gotera. Odilia vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Odilia recientemente ha montado su negocio una venta D. tortillas desD. su domicilio, la cual ya es la preferida D. muchos en la zona, Odilia es reconocida en la por su amabilidad al atender a su clientes, el crédito que solicita es para compra maíz y leña para aumentar su producción.

loans.use: para compra maíz y leña para aumentar su producción

loans.name: Enatha

texts.en: Enatha U. is 34 years old and is married with 2 young children.  She lives in the Gasabo District in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.  Enatha has been an entrepreneur many years.  She employs 2 people in her retail food shop business. Enatha has 10 years of experience selling a variety of fresh and canned goods in her shop. This is her first loan with Vision Finance Company.  This loan will allow Enatha to purchase more inventory for sale in her shop to attract more customers and (hopefully) make more profits.  Enatha currently hopes to make monthly profits of 100,000 RWF (approximately $US180).

loans.use: More merchandises

loans.name: Olivia Nakintu's Group

texts.en:
Olivia is a 33 year old  married with four children, between the ages of 3 and 15. All her children go to school. Olivia takes care of additional family members. She owns a two-room house where she lives with six people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses  include medication and feeding the family. She works seven days a week.Olivia owns a stall selling second hand clothes. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to get to and from her suppliers. Olivia doesn’t pay rent but pays  monthly market dues and operation license fees. She faces the challenges of increasing clothes prices and defaulters. Olivia sells to all kinds of people and serves about 20 customers a day 
Olivia has been in the clothing business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years. She is on her sixteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more used clothing.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothing

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 60 años y 03 hijos ya independientes.Teresa de Jesús, lleva varios años dedicándose a la costura, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se dedica a arreglar pantalones, blusas y vestidos y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Teresa de Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús has been working as a seamstress for many years. Little by little she was generating her own income and saving her money. She makes pants, blouses, and dresses. She tells us that it is going very well for her. She is set up in her own house where she takes care of her customers. She works by special order. She is currently in the same business and has faithful customers who go to her house every day to put in orders. She personally attends to her customers with the kindness that she is noted for. With this loan for 800 PEN she will buy meters of different types of fabrics, instruments she uses like scissors, sewing needles and machine needles, pins, and buttons. Teresa de Jesús now feels like an accomplished woman with a great desire to achieve and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping a lot of women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meters of fabric, needles, and pins

loans.name: Ana Yaneth

texts.es: Ana Yaneth S. R. de 36 años de edad reside en Colon, La Libertad. Ana vive con sus dos hijas Telma de 16 años y Estefanni 8 años. Ana tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa la cual por motivos evidentes económicos lucha por mantener a flote su negocio y es por eso que en esta oportunidad  solicita de un crédito que le permita surtir de mayor variedad de mercadería para su negocio.

loans.use: surtir de mayor variedad de mercadería para su negocio.

loans.name: Julia Nenith

texts.es: La señora Julia Nenith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 55 años, 05 hijos independientes.Con el fin D. incrementar sus ingresos económicos y motivada por una ella misma, decidió iniciar  en sus ratos libres la venta D. ropas interiores, D. la línea Leonisa y catty ross, donD. sus clientes lo piden por catalogo mensualmente, poco a poco fue haciéndose D. su propio  stock, para esto ya contaba con mas capital.Hoy continúa con su negocio ubicado en su misma casa, donD. sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará para incrementar su stock D. ropas interiores como: calzones, bikinis, brasieres, pijamas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Julia Nenith, tiene un carácter alegre y un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Nenith belongs to the Communal Bank, “Las Triunfadoras”, in the Banda D. Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is a widow, is 55 years old, and has 5 independent children. With self-motivation and the goal of growing her economic investments, she decided to begin to sell Leonisa and Catty Ross brand underwear in her free time. As her clients have been ordering monthly by catalog, she has been able, little by little, to build her own stock and now has more capital. Today, she runs her business out of her own home, where her principal clients are neighbors and friends. She tells us that her business is going very well since she now has regular clients. With this loan of 1,500 PEN she will increase her stock of underwear by buying items such as: socks, bikinis, bras, and pajamas for women, men, and children. Julia Nenith has a happy and charismatic character, helping her sell to her clients, according to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which is an organization that helps women develop themselves and make progress by attaining the same opportunities as men.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lingerie merchandise.

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en:
Geralda is 50 year old single mother; her four children are between 20 and 30 years old. Two of her children go to school. She owns a three room house where she resides with three other people. Geralda takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no running water. 

Geralda works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala, to which she takes public transportation. She owns a stall selling rice. Geralda doesn't pay rent per se; rather, she pays daily market dues. She is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of rice and defaulters. Geralda sells to all categories of people and receives about 20 customers a day. She works seven days a week. Her monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family. 

She has been with MCDT for three years. This is her seventh loan with the same group mates. Geralda wants to use this loan to purchase more sacks of rice.

loans.use: purchasing more rice

loans.name: Rubidia Isabel

texts.es: Rubidia Isabel V. D. M. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en Ciudad Arce departamento La Libertad, vive con su esposo y su hija D. 22 años quien estudia.  Rubidia tiene una tienda D. consumo con 15 años D. experiencia en el negocio, el crédito que solicita Rubidia es para invertir en su negocio  el cual necesita D. variedad D. productos para ofrecer  a sus clientes, vale mencionar que  Rubidia  ya había obtenido créditos anteriormente y todos sus pagos fueron puntuales cancelando su crédito antes D. la fecha.
texts.en:
Rubidia Isabel V. D. M., 41, lives in the city of Arce in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and her 22 year old daughter who goes to school. Rubidia has a convenience store, and she has 15 years of experience in this business. The loan that Rubidia is asking for is to buy a variety of products that her business needs to offer to her customers. Ribidia has had previous loans, and all of them were repaid before they were due.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ayley Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ayley Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años y 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Ayley, lleva 8 años dedicándose a la costura, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se dedica a arreglar pantalones, blusas y vestidos y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Ayley, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayley Mercedes belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras,” in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married, is 41 years old, and has four children, two of whom are dependents.
