Ayley has been sewing for a living for 8 years, and, little by little, has been building her own investments and saving money. She mends pants, blouses, and dresses, and she tells us it is going very well for her. She works out of her own home, where she serves her clients. She works for clients on advanced orders. Right now, she is continuing with her business and she has a loyal clientele that daily comes to her home for her services. She waits on them personally with her characteristic friendliness. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will buy meters of various types of cloth and instruments such as scissors, sewing needles and sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Today, Ayley feels like a truly accomplished woman, with a greater desire to succeed and to make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and to all the other women with entrepreneurial aspirations.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meters of cloth, string, and needles.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La señora Marianela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Marianela, lleva varios años dedicándose a la costura, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará sabanas de diferentes colores y modelos, edredones de buena calidad.Marianella, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Marianela belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Communal Bank in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 32, single, and she has two children who are dependent upon her. Marianela has been working as a seamstress for several years. Little by little she has been earning her own income and saving money. She makes sheets and quilts. She tells us that things are going very well for her. She is set up in her own house, which is where she waits on her customers. She works by special order. She is currently in the same business and has faithful customers who go to her house every day to put in orders. She personally attends her customers with the kindness that she is known for. With this loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy different colors and types of good quality sheets and quilts. Marianella now feels like an accomplished woman with a big desire to achieve and make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets and quilts

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a 45 year single mother of 2 children, who are between 8 and 20 years old. All of her children go to school. She owns a four room house, in which she resides with seven people. Robinah takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and running water at home.

Robinah works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to get to and from this area. Robinah doesn’t pay rent but does pay daily market dues. She is faced with the rainy season as well.

Robina sells to all categories of people both wholesale and retail. She works seven days a week. Her monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family. 

She has been in this kind of business for ten years and with MCDT for three years; this is her sixth loan. She aspires to build up her business and eventually sell only wholesale.

loans.use: purchasing more used clothing

loans.name: Juana Concepción

texts.es: Juana Concepción H. D. M. D. 56 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella administra su propio negocio una cafetería ubicada en la aduana, con 18 años D. experiencia Juana es la favorita D. muchos, ya que sus clientes reconocen y prefirieren D. sus platillos, ahora ella solicita D. un crédito para comprar materia prima que utilizará en la cocina D. su comedor.
texts.en:
Juana Concepción H. D. M., 56, lives in the San Salvador department. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She runs her own business, which is a cafeteria at customs. With 16 years of experience, Juana is the favorite of many people. Her customers recognize and prefer her dishes. She is now asking for a loan to buy raw material, which she will use in the kitchen of her dining room.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing used clothes wholesale

loans.name: Retsy

texts.en:
Resty is a 45 year old single mother of 2 children between 8 and 20 years old. All of her children go to school. She resides and owns a four room house where she is staying with seven people. The family has access to electricity and running water at home. She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. To get to and from this area, she uses public transportation.

Resty sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Resty's monthly expenses include medication, feeding the family and school fees. Resty has been with MCDT for ten years; this is her twentieth loan  She wants to use this loan to buy more newspapers and magazines; she aspires to be a newspaper agent in her area.

loans.use: purchasing more newspapers and magazines

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old. She is married with three children between 1 and 10 years of age. Two of her children go to school. She resides in a two room house where she is staying with seven people. Agnes takes care of additional family members as well.

Agnes owns a pub selling soft drinks. She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for three years; this is her eighteenth loan and ninth year with MCDT. 

Agnes sells to all categories of people. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and other soft drinks.

loans.use: purchasing more crates of soda and other soft drinks

loans.name: Melissa Ivette

texts.es:
La socia Melissa, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, ella pertenece al grupo Ayni, ella es la fiscalizadora de su grupo y en esta ocasión ella solicita un préstamo individual.
 
Nuestra socia  tiene 26 años de edad, esta separada tiene hijo y ella realiza diferentes actividades, ahora ella compro un par de celulares y los activó para realizar llamadas a otros celulares y teléfonos fijos, desde sus equipos a personas o transeúntes que soliciten este servicio, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de equipos de celular mas y recarga todos sus equipos, ella cobra 0.50 céntimos de sol por minuto lo que equivale a 0.17 céntimos de dólar.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Comprar equipos de celular y recargar.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
God Is Great is a group of 2 borrowers led by Madusu K.,37 years old married with 2 children aged 4 months and 15 years old and the oldest child's educational level is 5th grade.
Madusu and her family lives Selegai high way,Voinjama the capital of Lofa county,northern Liberia.


Madusu K.'s business is a general goods shop. She buys general goods wholesale and sells to residents of Selegai Highway, Voinjama, capital of Lofa County, Northern Liberia. She has been running this business for six months and hopes to get a bigger shop. Madusu has been facing some financial problems with her business. She treats her customers well in order to encourage them to continue buying from her, and she believes her business will improve.

Madusu is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 4 months and 15 years. The older child is in Grade 5. Madusu lives with her family on Selegai Highway, Voinjama. She needs this loan in order to purchase goods like milk, batteries, candles and sugar to improve her business. Madusu dreams of giving her children a better education.

"God Is Great" is a group of two borrowers led by Madusu K..

loans.use: To purchase goods like milk, batteries, candles and sugar

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 28 years old and is married with three children between 4 and 9 years of age.  All her children go to school.  She owns a two-room house where she lives with six people. (Grace takes care of additional family members.)  She owns a retail shop selling daily essentials and works on the outskirts of Kampala.  She has been in this business for three years; she is on her tenth loan and has been with Kiva partner MCDT for nine years.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from home. Grace sells to all types of people.  She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for retail shop

loans.name: Blandine

texts.en:
Blandine M. is 38 years old, married with 6 children ages 3 through 12 and she also takes care of 10 dependents. Blandine has been in the business of selling eggs for the past 7 years. Blandine employs 2 people in her shop, which is open from 6AM-9PM every day. Blandine is requesting her first loan with Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more eggs for sale.
Through accessing this loan, Blandine hopes to increase her monthly profits, which will help her to pay school fees and get more food for her children.

loans.use: More merchandise

loans.name: Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi

texts.fr: O. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi est née le 08/10/1971 à Sakété dans le Département du Plateau. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi est mariée à AMBALIOU Razack. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi et Razack ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Pk10 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi vend les produits cosmétiques (parfum, crème, lait corporel, déodorant, défrisant, etc.). Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi vend ses produits dans son quartier à Pk10 et s'approvisionne en ces différents produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi a eu deux crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité à la grande satisfaction de sa clientèle Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi O. was born on 8 October 1971 in Sakété in the Department of Plateau. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi is married to Razack Ambaliou. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi and Razack have three children, all of whom are in school and still in the care of their parents. The family lives in Pk10 area in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sells cosmetics (perfume, cream, body milk, deodorant, hair straightener, etc.). Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sells her products in her locality in Pk10 and supplies herself with these goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi has already obtained two loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid these loans properly. In order to increase the volume of her business and satisfy her customers, Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, ella es natural de Quillabamba la ciudad el eterno verano; ubicada ahora en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad, ella se separo de su pareja y es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia compra ropa de lima, y otras ciudades y las vende aquí en Cusco, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de mayor mercadería y así tener más oportunidades de ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.

Nuestra socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago establecido mediante el cronograma en el tiempo fijado.
texts.en:
Georgina belongs to the community bank Ayni. She is originally from Quillabamba, the city of eternal summer. Now she lives in Cusco. She is 54 years old, separated from her husband, and a single mother of two. She alternates her responsibilites at home with running a small business. She buys clothes in Lima and other cities to sell in Cusco. She is asking for a loan so that she can invest in buying more merchandise so she has the opportunity to offer variety to her clients. She values and appreciates the loan given through Kiva and promises to fulfill her payment within the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa es una persona soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en una casa que es propia y está ubicada en una zona central de la comunidad. Maria Teresa es docente y también se dedica a la venta de comida los fines de semana. En  ambos rubros, es decir en la docencia y en la venta de comidas, cuenta con una amplia experiencia  lo cual le permite trabajar normalmente dentro de un mercado que es medianamente competitivo para este tipo de actividades, en especial en el negocio de la venta de comida, además que cuenta con clientela fija. El destino del crédito fue para la compra de una moto que le servirá para alquilarla y percibir ingresos de esa manera. Maria Teresa cuenta con un buen historial crediticio en nuestra Institución y también en el sistema financiero en general.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MOTO

loans.name: Maria Yanet

texts.es: Maria Yanet es una señora que está casada, tiene dos hijos que cuentan con 3 y 7 años de edad respectivamente, la familia vive en una casa que es propia y que se encuentra en la comunidad. Maria Yanet  se dedica al negocio de la venta de comidas y refrescos, tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio, el nivel de competitividad en el rubro es de nivel medio por la zona. El destino del crédito fue para incrementar dinero para la adquisición de una vagoneta, misma que le permitirá desplazarse de mejor manera. Maria Yanet tiene un buen historial crediticio en nuestra Institución, todo el tiempo de la relación comercial demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria Yanet is married and has two children; they are three and seven years old. The family lives in their own house, which is in the community. Maria Yanet sells food and soft drinks. She has a lot of experience in the business. The level of competition in the field is medium. The loan is to buy a small wagon, which will allow her to travel in a better way. Maria Yanet has a good credit history with our Institution. During the entire time of our commercial relationship she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible person who is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a small wagon

loans.name: Roukayatou Adédjokè

texts.fr: O. Roukayatou Adédjokè est née le 24/09/1974 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Roukayatou Adédjokè est mariée à EFIYEMI Camille, un soudeur. Roukayatou Adédjokè et Camille ont deux enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Pk10 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji. Roukayatou Adédjokè vend les produits divers (pâte dentifrice, brosse à dent, savon, lampe torche, etc.). Roukayatou Adédjokè vend ses produits dans son quartier à Pk10 et s'approvisionne en ces différents produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Roukayatou Adédjokè a eu deux crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité à la grande satisfaction de sa clientèle Roukayatou Adédjokè sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Roukayatou Adédjokè O. was born on 24 September 1974 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Roukayatou Adédjokè is married to Camille Efiyemi, a welder. Roukayatou Adédjokè and Camille have two children in the care, both of whom are in school. The family lives in the Pk!0 area in the village of Sèmè-Podji. Roukayatou Adédjokè sells a variety of products (toothpaste, toothbrushes, soap, flashlights, etc.). Roukayatou Adédjokè sells her products in her area of Pk10 and supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Roukayatou Adédjokè has already obtained two loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid these loans properly. In order to increase the volume of her business and satisfy her clientele, Roukayatou Adédjokè is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for resale: toothpaste, toothbrushes, soap, flashlights, etc.

loans.name: Rimer

texts.es: Rimer es un señor casado, cuenta con 26 años de edad, la pareja tiene una niña y todos viven en una casa que les fue prestada por su suegro. Rimer se dedica al transporte de pasajeros de la ciudad donde vive hasta una provincia próxima que se encuentra a 1 hora de viaje, hace este tramo de ida y retorno desde hace aproximadamente más de 5 años. Su esposa atiende su tiendita de barrio en su domicilio. La competencia en este rubro es regular, pero él pertenece a una asociación de transporte que tiene presencia de varios años atrás, lo que le asegura una cartera de clientes, además por los años en este rubro él es buscado por personas de la zona para realizar transporte o carreras especiales. El destino del crédito fue para la adquisición de dos pares de llanta para el vehículo e insumos para la tiendita que tiene su esposa en la casa donde viven. Con nosotros hasta la fecha tiene un comportamiento bueno y no tiene experiencia crediticia con otras instituciones.

loans.use: COMPRA DE LLANTAS E INSUMOS TIENDA DE BARRIO (ESPOSA)

loans.name: Timan

texts.fr: Cette femme dispose d’une boutique de vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2004 et cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer ; dans cette boutique, elle vend des produits alimentaires comme les petits pois, les tomates en boîtes, les sardines. Elle vend aussi des couches jetables pour enfants. Sa boutique est bien située dans le marché, ce qui fait que cette dame réalise de bonnes affaires. Elle sait aussi bien accueillir sa clientèle. Avec tous ses atouts, elle a su fidéliser la plupart de ses clients. Actuellement elle veut constituer de nouveaux stocks ; pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 cartons de sardines, 20 cartons de tomates en boîtes, 12 cartons de petits pois, 20 cartons de lait Nestlè mais aussi des couches jetables pour enfants. Elle est mère d’un enfant.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: El Carmen es un grupo dinámico sus edades varían entre los 25 - 31 - y los 55 años. La presidenta tiene dos hermosos hijos y ambos están en la escuela. La señora Juana se siente muy feliz porque sus clientes le dicen que cocina muy rico y se siente muy orgullosa .La señora  Aleida que es la secretaria de actas es una persona líder en su grupo y esto hace que tenga mucho más entusiasmo en todas sus actividades. El 80 % de las señoras se dedica a la venta de chamaras algunas tienen puestos en la calle y otras están en una galería. Las demás socias se dedican a actividades como la venta de comida, venta de batidos, y la venta de cosméticos. Hay  bastante competencia en la venta de chamaras pero ellas confían en su negocio ya que en  la ciudad donde viven hace bastante frio. En la venta de comida de igual manera existe competencia pero ellas tienen clientes fieles. Las socias quieren incrementar su mercadería de chamaras aprovechando el tiempo lluvioso de estas épocas, la señora que vende comida quiere para compra de víveres por mayor. Este grupo está en su primer ciclo pero tienen experiencia con otras instituciones. Ellas se conocen entre sí y son responsables puesto que el negocio es un mismo sector.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, ella es natural de la provincia de Espinar; actualmente ubicada en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y ella sola se encarga de la educación, alimentación y cuidados de sus hijos, lo cuál hace que la socia trabaje mucho y horas extras, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia aprendió desde muy pequeña a elaborar la artesanía, convirtiéndolos en bellas, vasijas, utensilios de cocina en barro, ella hace trabajos en arcilla, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para seguir reinvirtiendo en su negocio y de este modo tener mayor producción.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank "Ayni." She is originally from the Espinar province and currently lives in the city of Cusco. She is 43 years old and is a single mother of three children. She alone has been in charge of the education, feeding and care of her children. For this reason she works very hard and for long hours. She alternates her activities from the home with retail commerce. When she was very young, she learned to make handicrafts. She works in clay, making beautiful objects such as pots and earthenware cooking utensils. She is requesting a loan to continue reinvesting in her business so that she can have increased production. Julia appreciates and values the loan granted, and she pledges to make the payments on her debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for handicrafts

loans.name: Adoté Gille Hervé

texts.fr: Cet homme fait un commerce d’un genre particulier : il achète des sacs de qualité au Togo qu’il revend en Côte d’Ivoire. Il a débuté cette activité en 2007 ; il est marié et un enfant à sa charge. Cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il revend en Côte d’Ivoire ces sacs qu’il revend en gros mais parfois en détail. Il maîtrise parfaitement le marché ivoirien et n’a aucune inquiétude pour agrandir encore plus ses activités dans ce pays. Il sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour commander des sacs ; le reste lui prêt couvrira ses frais de transport vers la Côte d’Ivoire.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de sortie pour dames

loans.name: Maurielle

texts.fr: A. Maurielle est mariée à KIFOULI Prosper, un chauffeur. Maurielle et Prosper ont trois enfants tous encore à leur charge. Maurielle et sa famille vivent à Ekpè dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji depuis huit ans. Maurielle est couturière mais en plus de la couture elle vend des articles de mercerie et des tissus ainsi que des fournitures scolaires. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Maurielle s'approvisionne en ces différents produits et les vend chez elle à la maison à son atelier de couture. Pour mieux développer son atelier de couture et élever le niveau de ses services, Maurielle sollicite un crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Maurielle A. is married to Prosper Kifouli, a driver. Maurielle and Prosper have three children, all of whom are still in their care. Maurielle and her family have lived in Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, for eight years. Maurielle is a seamstress, but in addition to that, she sells dressmaking and tailoring supplies and fabric as well as school supplies. It is at Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, that Maurielle obtains her supplies of these different products, which she sells at home in her dressmaking shop. To further develop her shop and raise the level of her services, Maurielle is seeking a loan through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and dressmaking/tailoring supplies

loans.name: Señor  De Mayo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado SEÑOR DE MAYO  está conformado por trece personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 60 años. La presidenta de la banca la Sra. Patricia es una persona de carácter fuerte y proactiva que tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo una está en colegio, La Sra. Alisan  secretaria de la banca en una persona tranquila pero proactiva que en conjunto con sus vecinos forman parte de la banca, el Sr. Rene es una persona con carácter muy alegre y colaborador, las otras personas que conforman la banca son de personalidades similares. La presidenta administra un pequeño local de juegos electrónicos mismos establecidos en su domicilio,  la secretaria se dedica  a la venta de productos lácteos  en la feria de la zona otra parte también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a pedido, otra parte de los socios se dedican a conducción de vehículos de transporte público, otro de los socios se dedica a la administración de un pequeño café Internet, otro de los socios a la  venta de celulares. Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollaban en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas de las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito.  Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de  repuestos y mantenimiento  para sus equipos otros para  el incremento de mercadería, otras para la compra de materiales de construcción  para el ampliado de sus pequeños locales y dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Este grupo se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, por lo cual  la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.

loans.use: COMPRAS DE MERCADERIA  Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Magda Rosa

texts.es: Magda Vásquez de 46años de edad, habita en la colonia Centroamérica, casada, con dos hijos actualmente lo tiene estudiando, su esposo trabaja como diseñador grafico y le ayuda económicamente, tiene como planes la construcción de su vivienda y mejor el nivel de vida para que sus hijos sean profesionales. Como mujer emprendedora inicio su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y joyas. Lo inicio con fondo propios, un año y medio tiene el negocio de estar ofreciendo su servicio. Ha encontrado dificultades en la colocación de su producto al crédito. Este es su segundo ciclo el cual lo invertira en la compra de producto como: ropas para damas, niños y caballeros, zapatos, perfumes y otros productos para esta temporada de navidad el cual se espera un aumento en las ventas. Ofrecerle al cliente un producto de calidad y a su comodidad es el objetivo y a su vez aumentar las ventas generándoles mayores utilidades.

loans.use: Comprar ropa, zapatos y cosmeticos

loans.name: Afi Enyonam

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 1990 des bois de chauffe et des claies servant de clôture pour les maisons. Elle est mariée et est mère de 04 enfants. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail ; elle est bien connue dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé où elle réalise de bonnes affaires ces temps-ci. Elle maîtrise parfaitement ce secteur de vente ; elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans une ville située à plusieurs kilomètres de Lomé. Elle voudrait d’ores et déjà lancer une nouvelle commande car il est difficile de trouver des claies pendant la saison pluvieuse. C’est pour cela qu’il compte sur un crédit de WAGES pour acheter en quantité considérable aussi bien les claies que les bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
Since 1990, this lady has sold firewood and wooden fence posts for houses. She is married and has four children. She sells in bulk and at retail; she is well known in the Kégué area of Lomé, where she realizes a good profit these days. She has perfectly mastered this business activity; she obtains her supplies in the interior of the country in a town located several kilometres from Lomé. She would like to make a new order already because it is difficult to find wooden fence posts during the rainy season. It is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy a large quantity of fence posts as well as firewood.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and wooden fence posts

loans.name: Kodjovi Gagno

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un mécanicien qui a ouvert son garage de mécanique auto en 2007. Le garage est situé dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Avec le temps, il profite aussi pour vendre des pièces détachées d’automobiles. Il dispose de 05 apprentis mécaniciens qui l’aident dans ses prestations. Il s’approvisionne au Ghana en pièces détachées à moindre coût pour les revendre ensuite à ses clients qui sont dans le besoin. Cette vente lui permet de réaliser de bonnes marges bénéficiaires. C’est pour acheter de nouvelles pièces détachées pour auto qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a mechanic who opened his own automobile repair garage in 2007. The garage is located in the Hédzranawoé area of Lomé. Over time, he has also benefited from the sale of spare automobile parts. He works with 5 apprentice mechanics who help him in his duties. He supplies himself in Ghana with low-cost spare parts in order to then re-sell them to customers who need them. This sale allows him to realize a good profit margin. It is to buy new spare parts that he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners). He is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare automobile parts

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, la socia actualmente esta ubicada en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista ella vende golosinas en una carreta en la esquina de su barrio,  presta servicio de llamadas telefónicas a diferentes celulares de forma ambulatoria, y también elabora joyas (bisutería). Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder seguir invirtiendo en sus diferentes ocupaciones y de este modo ella sueña comprar su casa y construirla, lo cual estamos seguros que lo logrará, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y disciplinada.

Nuestra socia esta muy feliz y agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con las cuotas a pagar en llas fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Josefina belongs to the Ayni community bank. The member is currently located in the city of Cusco. Our partner is 35 years old and is a single mother. She alternates her household activities with retail sales. She sells treats in a cart on the corner of her neighborhood, offers fast service for cell phone calls to various clients, and also makes jewelry. Our partner requires the loan to continue investing in her several occupations, and so she dreams of buying a home and building it. We are sure that it will succeed because this woman is very hardworking and disciplined. Our partner is very happy, and appreciates and values the granted loan and agrees to comply with the amounts to be paid on the established dates.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Re-invest in her retail business

loans.name: Porvenir Feminino 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Flavia is the coordinator of her group Provenir Femenino. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Her group is based in the Samana peninsula in an area where there is little access to running water (none of which is potable) and the electrical grid is very unreliable. There she makes her home with her five children in a home that, while providing the necessities, is very far from the commercial center of Samana. 

This is Flavia's seventh loan with Esperanza and she has shown herself to be a reliable associate, repaying all six previous loans without incident. She is taking this new loan to purchase more gasoline to sell to her neighbors and wells as coconuts which she processes to make coconut oil. She believes that the profits from this business will improve her life and the lives of her children by allowing her to take a course in English and photography so that she can change jobs. She says that working with the coconutsis very hard work and she would prefer to work in Samana City and eventually save enough money to move there. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Gasoline to sell and Coconuts to turn into oil

loans.name: Chakiratou-Laï

texts.fr: A. Chakiratou-Laï est née le 07 août 1982 à Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Célibataire avec deux enfants dont un à sa charge,  Chakiratou-Laï vit seule avec eux au quartier Midombo, à Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Chakiratou-Laï a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire et tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Chakiratou-Laï est spécialisée dans la vente de cartes de recharges téléphonique de tous les réseaux du Bénin depuis près de quatre ans. Chakiratou-Laï achète ces recharges auprès des distributeurs et les vend à Midombo et à Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Pendant la période de la rentrée, Chakiratou-Laï vend également des fournitures scolaires qu’elle achète chez les papeteries modernes. Chakiratou-Laï a obtenu déjà cinq crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Dans l’optique de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse de la clientèle en cette période de rentrée des classes et accroître ses parts de marché, Chakiratou-Laï sollicite un sixième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Chakiratou-Laï A. was born on 7 August 1982 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Unmarried with two children in her care, Chakiratou-Laï lives alone with her children in the Midombo district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Chakiratou-Laï attended school up to the secondary level, and all of her children are in school. For about four years, Chakiratou-Laï has specialized in the sale of rechargeable phone cards for all of Benin's telephone networks. Chakiratou-Laï buys these cards from distributors and sells them in Midombo and Sainte Rita in Cotonou. During the time when the school year restarts, Chakiratou-Laï also sells school supplies, which she buys from modern stationery stores. Chakiratou-Laï has already obtained five loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners), all of which she repaid properly. With the goal of better satisfying the numerous demands of her customers during the start of the school year and increasing her market share, Chakiratou-Laï is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell school supplies

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Angelica; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, ella es natural de la provincia de Sicuani,  actualmente ubicada en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 58 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia trabaja mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella se dedica al comercio minorista, nuestra socia compra y vende ropa, la socia desea que se le otorgue el préstamo para poder viajar a la ciudad de Lima a comprar ropa de invierno para vender en la ciudad del Cusco ahora que llega la temporada de crudo invierno.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the communal bank “Ayni”. She is originally from the province of Sicuani and now lives in Cusco. Our member is the 58 year old single mother of 3 children. She works a lot to help her kids get ahead by buying and selling clothing on a small scale. She would like a loan so she can travel to Lima to buy winter clothing to sell in Cusco, since winter is coming. Our member is grateful for the loan and promises to pay off her debt in the agreed upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et est mère d’un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de bijoux dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa part financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle gère bien son commerce, ce qui lui permet d’avoir l’estime et le respect de son mari. Elle s’approvisionne au Bénin où elle achète des perles et bijoux de qualité, qu’elle revend à Lomé. Les femmes des services publics et privés viennent faire des commandes de bijoux chez elle. Elle sait bien accueillir sa clientèle. Elle veut acheter de nouveaux bijoux en ce moment ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des montres bracelets pour dames et hommes, des colliers en or sur commande ainsi que d’autres articles de qualité.
texts.en:
This lady is married and has one child. She runs an income-generating business selling jewelry at the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé. This business allows her to contribute financially to the running of her household. She manages her business well, which earns her the respect of her husband. She supplies herself in Benin, where she buys pearls and high-quality jewelry, and then re-sells these items in Lomé. Women in both the private and public sectors come to order jewelry from her. She knows how to accommodate her customers. Currently, she wants to buy new jewelry; it is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy ladies' and men's wristwatches and custom-made gold necklaces, as well as other high-quality items.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell jewelry

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: El señor Silvio Bermúdez de 56 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado, tiene seis hijos todos trabajan y tiene ya sus propias familias. Planes para su familia es que crezca su negocio para brindarles su ayuda a los hijos que la necesiten. Inició su propio negocio de venta de granos básicos y lácteos. Unos de los primeros productos que ha vendido es el fríjol, el viaja a los departamento de Matagalpa, Estile donde compra el fríjol barato y así darlo a menor precio y vender mas, como lo compra a buen precio le saca buena ganancia,  desde hace diecisiete años  vende y con el paso del tiempo a renovado las venta con nuevos productos como son los productos de lácteos. Agradece a la Institución por este nuevo ciclo del préstamo otorgado para la compra de producto como: queso, crema, frijoles, arroz, maíz y cacao. Permitiendo mayor captación de clientes generandole mayores utilidades y beneficio para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, lacteos, y cacao

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: F. Hélène est née en 1979 à Dangbo, un village périphérique de Porto-Novo capitale politique du Bénin. Hélène est mariée à KOUGNIHO Benjamin un agent de sécurité. Le couple réside depuis sept ans à Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Hélène a deux enfants tous scolarisés qui vivent avec les deux parents. Mais seul le mari de Hélène supporte les charges de la famille. Hélène vend de façon ambulante et à Dantokpa (marché internationale du Bénin) des tissus locales qu’elle achète au Nigéria et à Lomé au Togo, deux pays voisins du Bénin. Hélène a déjà onze ans d’expérience dans ce métier. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de réaliser plus d’économies, Hélène sollicite auprès de ALIDé un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Hélène F. was born in 1979 in Dangbo, a village on the outskirts of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Hélène is married to Benjamin Kougniho, a security guard. The couple has spent seven years living in the Agbodjèdo area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Hélène has two children, both of whom live with their parents and go to school. However, only Hélène's husband provides for the family. Hélène goes door-to-door and to Dantokpa (the international market of Benin) to sell local fabrics that she buys in Nigeria and in Lomé, Togo, two countries that border Benin. Hélène has eleven years of experience in this job. With the aim of enlarging her business and realizing more savings, Hélène is seeking her first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell local fabrics

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin, L. Suzanne vit depuis sept ans à Minontchou à Cotonou. Suzanne est mariée à DAOUDOU Christian, un imprimeur. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le mari de Suzanne. Suzanne vend à son domicile et à Dantokpa (marché international du Bénin), des bijoux et des colliers qu’elle achète à Dantokpa. Suzanne a déjà fait onze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Pour développer son activité et se ravitailler en bijoux, Suzanne sollicite l’aide de ALIDé pour l’obtention d’un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Suzanne L. has lived for seven years in the Minontchou area of Cotonou. Suzanne is married to Christian Daoudou, a printer. The couple does not have any children yet. The household expenses are taken care of by Suzanne's husband. Suzanne sells at home and at Dantokpa (the international market of Benin) jewelry and necklaces that she buys at Dantokpa. Suzanne has already gained eleven years of experience in this business. To develop her business and replenish her stock of jewelry, Suzanne is looking to obtain her first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell jewelry

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda J. lives in the village of Sto. Lagay, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She is 57 years old and is married to Joel J., who works as a tailor. Rosalinda supplements her husband's income by raising pigs and vegetable farming.  She works hard to improve the living condition of her family, providing for all their basic needs, education and future security. 

In January 2005, Rosalinda knew that the little she and her husband earned would not meet the needs of their child, so she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could borrow enough capital to start her general store. When she received her loan, she bought the most sellable products to sell in her store, and she reinvested the income into the business as revolving working capital. As her business continued to improve, she was also able to help advance her husband's business with some of her loans from NWTF-PD. Their combined monthly net income averages around PHP 13,000 and they invest most of it back into their respective businesses, after taking some out to cover their household expenses.

In her previous loan she borrowed Php 13,000 as additional capital for her general store. She paid back the loan in weekly installments and was able to fully pay it back within the loan term. Now she is borrowing PHP 10,000 for her eighth cycle loan, which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store and also to buy a pig to raise and sell after a few months. The income from this loan will be used for their household expenses, school expenses, and as capital for fish vending.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her general store and to buy a pig to raise and sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y ella pertenece al banco comunal, Chaska ñahui, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 51 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella trabaja de empleada en una agencia de viajes y turismo. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo de dinero otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ernestina is originally from Cusco and is a member of the communal bank “Chaska ñahui,” which is located in Cusco. Our member is 51 years old, married, and has 2 children under eighteen. She alternates her time between home and work. She is an employee in a travel and tourism agency and is asking for a personal loan. Our member is grateful for, and values, the loan money and promises to pay her monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal loan

loans.name: Doudou

texts.fr: Doudou S.  est un couturier complet, âgé de 30 ans qui gère un atelier avec prés de 5 élèves apprentis. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit pour l’acquisition d’une machine à coudre .Cette fois ci il sollicite ce prêt pour agrandissement et le renforcement de son activité et prendre en charge l’éducation de ses élèves couturiers. Ainsi, il trouvera des revenus pour nourrir sa famille

loans.use: achat de garnitures

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: F. Odile est née en 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Odile vit depuis huit ans au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou. Mariée à KOUTCHADE Magloire, un agent du Port Autonome de Cotonou, Odile n’a pas encore d’enfant. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le mari de Odile. Odile a arrêté les classes au secondaire, et depuis près de dix ans, elle vend du riz, maïs et des chaussures dans son domicile. Odile achète ces différents produits à Lomé au Togo (pays voisin du bénin) et à Missèbo au Bénin. Odile a eu antérieurement à ALIDé deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Odile sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de l’institution, pour augmenter le stock de ses produits et satisfaire mieux la demande. Odile ambitionne diversifier son activité par la vente de bazins.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de riz, de sacs de maïs et des paires de chaussures

loans.name: M'balu

texts.en:
For four years, M’Balu K. put aside a small portion of her household food allowance as savings. Her hope was to start her own business selling food products in the local market. Last year M’Balu achieved that goal and began her new enterprise in a central, open-air market in Makeni. She sells food products—her bestsellers being macaroni, a local spice (Maggi), and tomatoes. Among many other small stalls selling dried fish in plastic containers, M’Balu’s shop stands out. Her products are arranged in neat, tidy rows resembling a pyramid. In her first year in business, M’Balu has been very happy with her turnover but is always thinking of how she can move her inventory “fast, fast” and increase her sales volume. Smiling, M’Balu spoke several times about her desire to expand her business. She hopes to one day own a proper shop of her own and is sticking to her tried and true past strategy of accumulating daily savings until she is ready to purchase a store.

M’Balu is a 38-year-old, married mother of five children. In addition to her children, aged four to seventeen, M’Balu and her husband, who is a welder, support two of her younger brothers.

This is M’Balu’s first loan.

loans.use: To buy additional food items for her market stand

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 4 meses, en su casa propia. Desde niña se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo y actualmente lo sigue haciendo, pero en compañía de su esposo. Ellos siembran en grandes cantidades y una vez obtenida la cosecha la venden al por mayor en el mercado de su zona. El producto que mejores ganancias les da es el maíz, pero también crían animales y los venden una vez al año para obtener ingresos adicionales. El deseo de Ana es mejorar su producción y la cantidad de animales que posee. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, también es una experiencia nueva ser parte de un banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a poner todo de su parte para que su grupo trabaje en unión y solidaridad. El dinero que ahora solicita será para invertirlo en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina es una joven madre de 24 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde niña ha trabajado arduamente siendo un valioso apoyo para sus padres en sus terrenos agrícolas. Ahora, junto con su esposo, labra sus propias tierras, cultivando maíz, papa, trigo y otros productos. Adicionalmente cría ganado ovino en un espacio que acondiciona en su misma vivienda. El deseo a futuro de Carina y de su esposo, es seguir trabajando en sus tierras y mejorar su producción agrícola.

Esta es la primera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está muy entusiasmada por conocer a fondo como funciona un banco comunal y desde ya se ha comprometido a ser responsable con sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Carina is a young 24 year old mother who lives with her husband and two sons. Since she was a child, she has worked very hard, being a great help to her parents in their fields. Now, with her husband, she works her own land, cultivating corn, potatoes, wheat, and other products. She also raises sheep in a place she fixed up at her house. Carina and her husband hope to continue to work their land and improve their agricultural production. This is her first opportunity for a loan with MFP, and she is excited to learn more about how her communal bank works. She has promised to be responsible with her payments. The money she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for her next round of planting.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Elyse

texts.fr: H. Elyse est née le 26 Juillet 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elyse est mariée à AIVODJI Camille et vit depuis près de huit ans à Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Elyse n’a pas beaucoup évolué dans les études ; elle n’a atteint que le niveau primaire. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Elyse et son mari. Elyse est spécialisée depuis six ans, dans la vente de tissus et de pâtés ; elle exerce comme activité secondaire, la vente du riz et de macaroni.  Elyse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les vend au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou. C’est dans l’optique d’augmenter le stock de ses produits pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, que Elyse sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Elyse ambitionne disposer d’un lieu d’activité.
texts.en:
Elyse H. was born on 26 July 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Elyse is married to Camille Aivodji and has lived for about eight years in the Ayélawadjè area of Cotonou. Elyse was not able to pursue her studies much; she only reached primary school. The couple lives together with their four children, all of whom are in school. The household expenses are taken care of by Elyse and her husband. For six years, Elyse has specialized in the sale of fabric and food pastes; she also runs a secondary business selling rice and macaroni. Elyse buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sells them in the Sègbèya district of Cotonou. With the goal of increasing the stock of her products in order to better satisfy her customers, Elyse is seeking her first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). Elyse aspires to have her own business location.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat and peanut oil

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa de su suegra. Hace un año decidió dedicarse al cultivo de un terreno que adquirió como parte de la herencia de su esposo, siendo el maíz el producto que siembra, pues éste le permite obtener mayores ganancias. Su esposo no se dedica a la agricultura, pero durante las épocas de siembra y cosecha la ayuda con las labores. El deseo a futuro de Carmen es comprar más extensiones de terreno para que su producción sea mayor. 

Esta es la primera vez que adquiere un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sacos de abono y fertilizante para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Carmen is 21 years old and lives with her husband and children in her mother-in-law’s home. A year ago, she made the decision to cultivate some land she got as part of her husband’s inheritance. She plants corn because it provides higher income. Her husband doesn’t farm, but when it’s time to plant and harvest, he helps her. Carmen would like to buy more land in the future for better production. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises make her payments on time. She will buy sacks of fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es:
La socia Rosio; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos, la socia alterna sus diferentes labores del hogar con el trabajo independiente, ella es docente de profesión y a su vez realiza en sus horas libres el servicio de llamadas a celulares de forma ambulante en las esquinas, la socia trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su familia, ella solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y de este modo hacer algo mas grande y que le genere mayores beneficios.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago otorgado en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
Our member, Rosio, is a member of the communal bank “Ayni” and lives in Cusco. Our member is 37 years old and the mother of 2 children. She alternates her time between housework and freelance work. She is a professional teacher and in her free time offers cell phone service on street corners. She works hard to help her family get ahead and is asking for a loan so she can invest in her small business. In this way she could do something bigger that generates greater benefits. Our member thanks, and values, the loan and promises to meet her payments as they come due.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in small business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha trabajado en el campo ayudando a sus padres en las diferentes tareas que se le encomendaba, en aquel entonces, era el cuidado de los animales y la selección de la cosecha. En la actualidad sigue realizando estas tareas, pero con mayor intensidad en el cultivo de granos como el maíz, cebada y trigo, los cuales vende en el principal mercado de abastos de una de las ciudades más cercana a la suya. Ernestina y su esposo desean adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para que su producción sea mayor. 

Esta es la primera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras, y así produzca una buena cosecha.

loans.use: Compra de abono y fertilizantes

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu K. is a single parent selling provisions and cosmetics.  Her shop and home are rented and her business is located at her house.

She has four kids plus her mother, whom she is taking care of. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy cosmetics and provisions (drinks) to increase sales in the shop.

She has spent six years in business and hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her kids and buy land for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and provisions

loans.name: Martin Ismael

texts.es: Martin Ismael S. tiene 32 años, el tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y todos asisten a clases con el duro esfuerzo que realiza. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio a él siempre le ha gustado ganarse el pan de cada día de una manera muy humilde. El dio inicio a este negocio hace 2 años, empezó vendiendo recargas telefónicas, y más tarde decidió establecer golosinas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, gaseosas y ciertos productos de limpieza. Su deseo es tener prosperidad en su vida y en su trabajo.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Née le 18 Septembre 1975 à Dassa-Zoumè au centre du Bénin, T. Emilienne a arrêté très tôt les classes au primaire. Emilienne réside depuis trente ans dans le quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Emilienne est mariée à ALLOVOGBEGNON Prosper, un électricien bâtiment. Le couple a un enfant qui n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. Les charges de la famille sont supportées à la fois par Emilienne et son mari. Emilienne est une couturière de formation qui vend des habits et du charbon qu’elle distribue. Emilienne a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs obtenus à ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son activité en s’approvisionnant en tissus pour la conception d’habits, Emilienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Emilienne envisage plus tard vendre des sacs de charbon.
texts.en:
Born on 18 September 1975 in Dassa-Zoumè in central Benin, Emilienne T. stopped going to school very early on in primary school. Emilienne has been living for thirty years in the Agbodjèdo district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Emilienne is married to Prosper Allovogbegnon, a building electrician. The couple has one child who is not yet old enough to go to school. The household expenses are taken care of by both Emilienne and her husband. Emilienne is a dressmaker by training and sells clothing and charcoal. Emilienne repaid the previous loans she obtained through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) without problems. With the goal of strengthening her business by supplying herself with fabric to make dresses, Emilienne is seeking a new loan through ALIDÉ. In the future, Emilienne foresees selling bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) to make and sew clothing

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 54 años, es viudo y vive solo en su pueblo natal. Tiene 40 años de experiencia en las tareas agrícolas, esto le ha servido para sostener a su familia durante todo estos años y sus hijos ahora se encuentran viviendo en la ciudad debido a sus estudios. Pero cuando llega la época de siembra o cosecha, toda la familia se reúne para realizar las labores que demandan estas temporadas. Félix está muy satisfecho con lo que hasta ahora ha logrado a través de la agricultura, por lo que desea seguir trabajando en sus tierras hasta donde le alcancen las fuerzas, menciona.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, él se siente muy comprometido con su banco comunal para realizar un trabajo solidario. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono para su próxima siembra de papa y maíz.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Mohamed Jayah

texts.en:
Mr. Mohamed Jayah W. has two wives and a total of fifteen children. Four of the children are in secondary school, three in primary school, and the rest have yet to start school. He sells local foodstuffs (palm oil and garrie). He has been in business for 20 years at the main Lorry Park.

He needs a loan of Le 3,000,000 to purchase additional local foodstuffs to sell to business people in the township of Bo and Guinea. One of his wives is a businesswoman; the other is a matron at the children's home. 

He is assisted by four boys whom he pays on a daily basis. He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to pay his children's university fees and maintain the home.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and garrie

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie G. lives in the village of Brgy. Abahaw, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. She is 40 years old and is married to Dionito G. who is presently engaged in buying and selling cows, hogs and other farm animals. She has three young children who are between 1 to 16 years old, with the older two kids going to school. She aspires to be able to send all her children to college and earn their degrees so that they can have their own careers and be independent.

When she started, Lanie had little knowledge of handling a general store but she tried her luck, and was willing to learn from each experience, because it was the easiest way to earn money and help her husband earn a living. She asked for capital from her husband and invested it in a general store, but she is happy because she is proving that she can do it and help her family at the same time. She discovered that she enjoyed being in business and continued to improve operations until she realized that she needed a fresh infusion of capital to take her business to the next level.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 so that she could add to her current capital and invest it in a general store. As time moved on and her business steadily improved with each new loan, she was able to help her husband in his business as well. Now the combined monthly net income of their two businesses earns approximately PHP 8,000, which goes a long way in defraying the family's expenses.

In the previous loan, she borrowed Php 19,500 and used it for her general store business and the livestock business of her husband. This amount was paid in weekly installments and was fully paid without any delays. Now she is borrowing  Php 22,000 for her 15th cycle loan which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store and to buy more livestock to sell. The income from it will be used to improve their living conditions.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store and to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Chernor Umaru

texts.en:
Chernor Umaru B. is a trader located at the central business park of Shenge.  He deals in cosmetics. He is married and his wife normally assists in his absence.

He has five dependents, two of whom are his kids and are very young. He has 10 years of experience in business. He needs a loan of Le 4,000,000 to purchase additional stock of cosmetics so that he may expand and own another shop.

His shop and home are rented but he is determined to own a house and educate his kids.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena E. who lives in the village of So. Garilao, Brgy. Guintubhan Isabela Negros Occidental, is 54 years old, and married to Pedro E.. He is 58 years old and helps her in run the business. They are blessed with four children who are 22 to 30 years old. They have already finished their college education, earned their degrees and are gainfully employed. This makes Elena and Pedro happy because in spite of the hardships they went through, having their children become professionals is quite an achievement.

Elena and her husband sell vegetables and spices, moving to each town that is having their market day.  They travel very early in the morning so that they arrive at the location early enough to set up before the customers come to the market. This is not an easy business because a lot of unexpected things could happen, like holdups, accidents, losses due to damage and others. Because of her dream to improve their living and send all children to school, they never minded the difficulties but instead focused on the future. They continued to sustain their business and whatever income they got they used to pay for the education of their children and the family expenses. When they learned that there was an available space for rent at the Isabela Public Market, they grabbed the opportunity to have a permanent place to sell their vegetables, spices and some basic household commodities that are in demand with the locals.

The need for fresh capital to expand her business prodded her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon. In the five years that she has been a member of NWTF-PD, she developed her business and improved the living status of her family. Now she earns PHP 15,000 per month, a big amount that could satisfactorily sustain their needs and prepare for their future when they grow old. For now, she maintains her good credit performance in NWTF-PD because she wants to get bigger loans in the future.

Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 was used as additional working capital for her business. The loan was fully paid without any delay. Now she wants to borrow for her 9th cycle PHP 19,500 for her business. Whatever income there is will be used for the expansion of the business and for their future.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable and spice vending

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Née en 1973, M. Aïcha est veuve et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Aïcha réside depuis huit ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Aïcha est une analphabète qui vit seule avec ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par elle seule. Aïcha vend des sacs de charbon de bois et divers produits depuis environs treize ans à son domicile à Sègbèya. Aïcha s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin. Aïcha a déjà obtenu à ALIDé, deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour élever plus le niveau de son activité afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Aïcha sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Aïcha M. is a widow and has two children, both of whom are in school. For eight years, Aïcha has lived in the Sègbèya district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Aïcha is illiterate and lives alone with her two children. The household expenses are taken care of by her alone. Aïcha has been selling bags of charcoal and and various other products for about thirteen years at her house in Sègbèya. Aïcha supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Aïcha has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. To raise the level of her business so as to satisfy the demands of her customers and provide for her children, Aïcha is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: E. Chérifatou est née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Chérifatou réside depuis douze ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou. Mariée à ZANNOU Félix, Chérifatou est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Félix seul. Chérifatou vend depuis sept ans de la nourriture (riz, pâté fait à base de farine de blé) et des divers (sucre, lait, savons, pâte alimentaire) à Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Chérifatou fait ses emplettes à Dantokpa, au marché international du Bénin.  Chérifatou a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Pour agrandir son étalage de divers et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Chérifatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Chérifatou E. was born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Chérifatou has lived in the Sègbèya district of Cotonou for twelve years. Married to Félix Zannou, Chérifatou is the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. The household expenses are taken care of by Félix alone. For seven years, Chérifatou has been selling food products (rice, paste made from wheat flour) and various items (sugar, milk, soaps, food pastes) in Ayélawadjè in Cotonou. Chérifatou makes her purchases at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Chérifatou has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid them properly. To enlarge her selection of goods and better satisfy her customers, Chérifatou is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (canned food, cartons of milk, food pastes, etc.), bags of rice, and maize

loans.name: Virginia Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Virginia de 25 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos de 2, 4,5 y 8   años de  edad, estudiantes,  su esposo tiene un taxi el cual trabaja día a día en la capital de Managua, ella vende comida  desde hace tres años  el cual comenzó con su mama  a trabajar pero a invertido ahora las dos en el mismo negocio para tener cumplir con la demanda de los clientes, desde horas temprana se levanta para dejar el aseo En su Casa hecho ya que tienen que hacer desayunos para la venta como: gallo pinto, tajadas maduras, pollo, bistec y otras comidas rápidas. Con este crédito invertirán en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, verduras, lácteos y otros para preparar los ricos platos de comida. Se siente contenta por poder invertir en su  negocio y variar el menú de los alimentos para la captación de los clientes, vendemos al contado y algunos le damos créditos. cuando se vende la comida temprano da tiempo por las tardes de descansar es por eso. Agradece Afodenic por la oportunidad de los dos ciclos hasta el momento el espera poder pagar en tiempo y forma para seguir adelante en su comercio.
texts.en:
The young lady Virginia is 25 years old, married with four children, ages 2, 4, 5, and 8. Her husband has a taxi in which he works every day in the capital of Managua.

Virginia has sold food for three years. The business began with her mother working, but now they both have invested in the same business in order to keep up with the demand of their customers. She gets up very early in order to take care of the cleaning in her house since they have to make breakfasts for sale, such as rice and beans, sliced fruits, chicken, steak, and other fast foods.

With this loan, they will invest in the purchase of basic grains, meats, vegetables, dairy products and other foods required to prepare tasty dishes. She feels content because she is able to invest in her business and vary her menu in order to attract customers. She sells for cash and to some she extends credit. When she sells meals early, it gives her time in the afternoons to rest. She thanks Afodenic for the opportunity given through two loan cycles until now. She hopes to be able to pay on time and get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puirchase basic grains, meats, vegetables, and fruits

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: T. Eugénie est née en 1949 à Sakété, village proche de Porto-Novo capitale politique du Bénin. Eugénie vit depuis trente ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à OTEKPOLA Germain, Eugénie est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble et supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Eugénie vend de l’akassa (aliment fait à base d’amidon de maïs) et des poissons frits à son domicile à Sègbèya. Eugénie exerce cette activité depuis près de vingt ans déjà. Eugénie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Eugénie a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Pour agrandir plus son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Eugénie sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Esbelta Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Esbelta del Socorro Gonzáles tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio los Madrigales Norte, junto a su hija de ocho años de edad , ella es madre soltera se desempeña como domestica en una casa particular desde hace 15 años trabaja, cansada por la rutina y los quehaceres del oficio agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su tercer crédito ya que solo así esta logrando mejorar su vivienda  , los planes hacia un futuro es poder ver construida totalmente su casa , contenta por la confianza que le brinda la institución ya que le da facilidad de pagos y intereses bajos , los cuales con su salario cubre en tiempo y forma las cuotas que están estipulas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esbelta del Socorro Gonzáles is 49 years old and lives in the Madrigales Norte neighborhood with her 8-year-old daughter; she is a single mother. She has been performing housework in one particular home for 15 years and she is tired of the routine and the chores of the position. She is grateful to Afodenic for the great honor of her third loan, which she is using to improve her home. Her plans for the future are to see the completion of the construction of her house. She is happy because of the confidence that the institution has given her, facilitating easy and low-interest payments, and because of her salary, she is able to pay the stipulated installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of construction materials to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Hilvia

texts.es:
Hilvia tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez ha trabajado en las tareas agrícolas de su familia, pero desde hace 4 años decidió emprender (junto con su esposo) su propio negocio. Es así que abrió una tienda en su misma casa y le está resultando muy rentable, porque en su zona hay muy pocas bodegas, por lo que sus vecinos consumen mucho sus productos. Hilvia ofrece comestibles de primera necesidad, como son el azúcar, la leche evaporada, los fideos, el arroz, etc., también vende bebidas y golosinas. Por las mañanas atiende hasta el medio día y cuando es época de siembra o de cosecha trabaja toda la familia en sus cultivos. El deseo de Hilvia a futuro es mejorar su tienda ofreciendo mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas de superación, y se compromete a ser puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de más mercadería en arroz y azúcar.

loans.use: Incrmento de mercadería

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana tiene 45 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos. Desde pequeña ayudó a sus padres en las tareas del campo, tales como sembrar y cuidar a los animales. Ahora, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos, ella tiene ganado vacuno y ovino, y también animales menores como pollos y cuyes. Los productos que ella siembra son la papa y el maíz y con ambas actividades ha venido solventando las necesidades de su casa durante todos estos años, trabajando junto a su esposo. Para más adelante, Maximiliana desea tener un establo más grande donde pueda albergar a más animales y más extensiones de terreno para incrementar su producción agrícola.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmada con el trabajo en equipo que viene realizando en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono para sembrar más maíz.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Nemicia

texts.es:
Nemicia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas, pero actualmente enfoca sus esfuerzos a la actividad ganadera. Todas las mañanas sale a pastear a sus animales a zonas alejadas D. su casa, demorando hasta 2 horas D. camino hasta llegar a campos con pastos frescos y regresa aproximadamente a las 5 D. la tarD.. Pero cuando es la época D. siembra o D. cosecha ella y toda su familia participan en estos trabajos, pues son muy duros para una sola persona. Nemicia siente mucha gratitud por la agricultura porque durante muchos años, con ella, pudo sostener las necesidades D. sus hijos. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se siente muy contenta D. formar parte D. un banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra D. medicina para sus animales y también sacos D. abono.
texts.en:
Nemicia is 60 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She has been involved in agricultural work her whole life, but now she focuses her energy on ranching. Every morning, she takes her animals to graze in areas far from her house, spending up to 2 hours on the road before arriving at fields with fresh pastures, and then she returns around 5 in the evening. When it is planting or harvesting season, however, she and her whole family participate in this work, which would be very difficult for only one person. Nemicia is very grateful for her agriculture, because for many years it has allowed her to proviD. her children with the essentials. This is the first time she has received a loan from MFP and she is very happy to be part of a communal bank, so she is committed to being responsible with all her payments. The money she is soliciting now will be used for the purchase of medicine for her animals as well as sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and medicine for her animals

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 63 años, es viudo y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde niño ha estado dedicado a las tareas del campo, sus padres fueron sus principales mentores en estas tareas y toda su vida la ha consagrado a esta labor. Es así que día a día se sigue esforzando en la siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas, además de criar animales que vende los fines de semana en una feria ganadera cercana a su comunidad.
